Content: This app is so awesome. It has all of the shows and TV movies that I would find on HBO Max. Though it would be nice if Max can add all of the discovery plus TV shows and documentaries like how it is on the freestanding discovery plus app. Things like the Megastorm is not available, which talks about the typhoon that hit the Philippines. Also, under my list, I would like to see movies and TV shows separated into one area or a group. So, for example, when I click on my list, I would like to see, not just to continue watching option, but also a movies option which separates the movies from the TV shows and one into one category for movies, and then an option for TV shows where the TV shows are separated into their own thing which will make it easier for users to tell which one is a movie and which one is a show. So if we can get that that would be great. All in all, this is better than HBO Max. Especially with accessibility. Before I used to have to scroll down to see my watchlist. Now it‚Äôs just like all of the other apps where I can just click the left menu bar and then I have an option to click on watch list. I like it.
Title: Awesome App

Content: Overall, I‚Äôm mostly impressed with Max! HBO Max always had performance issues on some of my devices (including newer iPhones, but especially on an older iPad). But Max feels way smoother most of the time, with better search and scrolling performance. Also, with my existing year long HBO Max subscription, I continue to get 4k HDR at seemly pretty high bitrates (possibly higher than HBO Max?), so it makes me very happy that I wasn‚Äôt screwed over. On top of that, we get more content now. Even though HBO has far superior TV, sometimes you want to relax with HGTV or something similar, so I‚Äôm happy this is now an option without needing to pay more.   My hope is that they continue pushing Max to be a great platform in a way that multiple disparate underinvested platforms can‚Äôt be. My fear is that quality content from HBO doesn‚Äôt get the investment it deserves under the new WBD merger. (I guess we‚Äôll see.) One thing I am VERY disappointed in is the decision to cancel nearly finished movies and to remove completed, reputable shows like Westworld from the platform. How does that make any sense?   Honestly, the weird licensing deals which make it very confusing about what‚Äôs available where and when need to die, and it seems like Max is a step in the right direction from a company that has enough properties that one service could actually be consistently valuable. So far I‚Äôm impressed and cautiously optimistic.
Title: Much better performance and more content

Content: Why are we going backwards in functionality and user-friendliness with this new app? Did you enjoy being able to press the menu button to easily navigate to separate pages for ‚ÄòLast Chance‚Äô and ‚ÄòJust Added‚Äô items in the HBOMax app? Too bad. Gone. Now they‚Äôre just tiny rows located who knows how far down on the home page that you‚Äôll have to side scroll through and also who knows how these choices are organized, because it‚Äôs certainly not alphabetical. Did you enjoy having your watchlist arranged in alphabetical order? Well, too bad. Now it‚Äôs arranged in some arbitrary order that you can‚Äôt change. Remember how you were at least able to arrange your watchlist in alphabetical order (even though it didn‚Äôt stay that way the next time you opened the HBOMax app and you had to choose alphabetical order every time)? Oh well. Not anymore. I never knew just how important alphabetical ordering was to me until it was removed from this app. So far, I‚Äôve only started up one thing since the revamp and it had no issues starting, so that‚Äôs good at least. The lack of organization and organization options is aaarrrggggghhhhhh though!   On the plus side, it automatically logged me in so I didn‚Äôt have any issues there.   P. S. Bring back Metalocalypse.
Title: They should change the name to Min(imum) because they removed key elements

Content: Great options of shows & movies to watch however I have multiple problems when streaming from my phone to my TV. One, once I connect to TV it does not let me operate the rewind & pause from my phone like it typically should. Also it does not let me use subtitles at all when casting to TV which is very frustrating when I am hard of hearing. The tool menu pops up at the bottom of the app but no matter how many times I press subtitles on, or press pause, or rewind, it does not work. Sometimes the tool menu even pops up with no buttons AT ALL & I cannot control the movie. flawed and frustrating. I have no control over the movie or show I am watching, cannot pause, rewind, fast forward, or turn subtitles on. Also once I have streamed no matter how many times I close the app or turn my TV off & on it does not stop streaming, even after the app has been removed from my open & live section on my phone it is some how streaming in the background?? And for HOURS. I played a show around 11am then turned my TV off & removed the app from my open list then at 10pm I turn my tv on & re-open MAX & it immediately streams the same exact movie from 12hours ago?? Why did the movie not close from the lower tool bar & have the app reset like it should. Multiple problems of this app not resetting properly. Very unhappy & horrible change.
Title: Phone to TV Casting Flaw

Content: I am not sure how they messed up an app that was pretty good. The last update to the HBO max app ruined a lot of the features. I guess that was sign for how the new Max app was going to work. Not sure why they created a whole new app, makes no sense to rebrand it, everyone knows it‚Äôs HBO, but to discard all the good things that were created in the last app, and only add the bad things, doesn‚Äôt seem reasonable. When I first downloaded the HBO max app several years ago, it was full of bugs, but over the course of several updates they really smoothed it out. It ran very fast, worked as needed and seemed to anticipate changes that were needed by customers. That all changed in the last update and then the new app. I combine them as one because the problems of slow scrolling, bad menu displays and accessibility are the same. How do you fix this, just make it like your previous app and that should do the trick. I don‚Äôt understand how it‚Äôs so buggy, maybe by design? Your rebranding attempt was a failure.  The menu function to quickly go to Last Chance or other movie genres was a very feature one that was removed in this new app. I have read reviews that people are perplexed that others have written good reviews of this app, most likely it‚Äôs HBO employees or people who never used the old app, because it was far superior, at least before the last update.
Title: New app, even worse functionality.

Content: Have y‚Äôall over there at Warner Brothers development team ever heard the phrase if it‚Äôs not broken, don‚Äôt fix it? If so, why did you break HBO max? You used to have a bunch of cool features like being able to shuffle which would keep the program running for as long as you like. Now I have absolutely no option but to watch from season one episode one (or wherever I actually start the show from) until the finale. It also used to keep the shows in my list after watching the whole show because it‚Äôs still your show. No you must go back in there to the search. Find your show again. Just play it so you can go to sleep. How about the recently added or last chance sections of HBO max that are missing from this new app. While I will admit, I did not use those functions frequently. I did appreciate having them available. I‚Äôll give you two stars because the application does work. It does play the content requested but the original HBO max was at least by comparison a five star product compared to the two that I get this which is a mild stretch. Warner Bros dev team I understand that you guys have to justify your paychecks and feed your families a man next time in executive says that we need to revamp the whole ******* thing. Tell ‚Äòem to blow you. It‚Äôs funny the amount of reviews that looks almost identical to this one.
Title: MAX vs HBO-Max

Content: I‚Äôm actually really upset at the amount of people giving this good reviews. I have had nothing but issues the day I started using it. I‚Äôm currently rewatching a show & for some reason Max doesn‚Äôt want to leave it in my continue watching & on the progress bars it shows I‚Äôm no where through any of the episodes. If I can remember what episode I left off on, I can click on it & it resumes me at a random part of the video, not where I left off, or even at the beginning. Another issue I have is that when I click the skip intro option, it will sometimes (about half the time) only go through half of the intro but the skip button is no longer available. Not only are there issues, but y‚Äôall also took away features. Like the being able to upload one of your own pictures to your profile? Now, like Disney +, it only allows you to choose from the characters in some of their movies/tv shows, & the only options are honestly all the new or up incoming things, some of your most popular entertainment isn‚Äôt even an option. I just find it strange to remove features. I guess I just expected for Max to be this great new thing but was extremely let down. Please get to fixing the ‚Äòcontinue watching‚Äô issue because it‚Äôs very frustrating.
Title: Quality

Content: With the old app (HBO Max), everything worked smoothly. I used it both on my tv and my phone regularly to watch my favorite tv shows and movies. Literally recommending HBO to everyone, I was pleased. Ever since everything‚Äôs been transferred over to this new app, ‚ÄúMax‚Äù, it will not operate on my phone, nor my tv. I have done the simple updating, delete and redownload, restart the devices, and I keep having the typical problems that should‚Äôve been easily fixed with an update. the screen freezes at the choosing accounts screen and i cannot do anything besides exit out the app completely, and every show I watch will not stay on my continue watching. When I finish an episode into my favorite tv show, the app resets and says I haven‚Äôt watched a single episode at all, when in total i‚Äôve watched 12. i‚Äôve had this issue with all my shows and movies, where it won‚Äôt keep my spot, and reset and move it out of my continue watching and i have to go find the title and my spot again manually. with this happening with every single show and movie, along with the constant freezing on the screen with no response, i‚Äôm extremely disappointed. I thought it was only me, but my boyfriend and family are having the same Issue. what even happened here?? what an awesome streaming service that turned spotty and unreliable. unfortunate and disappointing.
Title: what is even happening?

Content: Every generation had their way of saying ‚Äúthis will work better than before‚Äù at times it may be true but in this case you had a situation where if it ain‚Äôt broke don‚Äôt fix it  It‚Äôs hbo not max stop trying to disassociate from the brand in order to make it seem like you‚Äôre bigger than you really are, you‚Äôll loose your fan base with these crazy moves don‚Äôt get me wrong there‚Äôs more diverse shows with the inclusion of discovery and the merger with time Warner, it‚Äôs just frustrating to have to download and redoubload update and login getting logged out dealing with bugs all that work just to put out a new app and a new name? And for what? To say it‚Äôs new? It‚Äôs the same crap different day, stop making your people run in place with these crazy capitalistic practices you call ‚Äúeconomy‚Äù  All that aside  I love your price point and inclusion in internet and tv providers it‚Äôs the best price point to carry for any person looking to maximize their screen time whilst still getting your bang for your buck the tv shows and films are great for people of all ages and I really do mean it there‚Äôs a show or film catered to someone you know
Title: Stop changing your name and app

Content: HBO max used to be a place where people can come together. Now it is a place where they isolate people. I own an HBO max account. I have now moved it to the ‚Äúmax‚Äù app where things are apparently different. Let me tell you why things are different. I own several different television sets. I have my own HBO or what I used to calll HBO on every single tv set. Now I for some reason can only use one or 2 television sets with MAX. So glad they changed it and upgraded their software to make it even more terrible than it was before. I can‚Äôt watch with more than 2. I work hard for those televisions and I want to enjoy every single one of them. All I want to do is watch  a show that I used to be interested in and this new update is ruining tv and as well as going along with our country‚Äôs new values that some people in this country have decided to partake in. I refuse to be apart of that. And while I do refuse to step foot in these childish political issues I cannot help but say that it is disappointing that HBO or as we now call it ‚ÄúMAX‚Äù is deciding to adhere to these insane ideas hurts me and is ruining American television and I can say that there are some great shows on the app. I just wish ‚ÄúMAX‚Äù as they call it can do what everyone in America wants them to do and make a change FOR THE GOOD instead of negative which is what I believe is happening right now.
Title: What happened ?

Content: I‚Äôve been using HBO Max since 2020, and I‚Äôve enjoyed the selections that have been available, with only a few exceptions (looking at you, Dragonball Evolution). When I managed to access Max (which transferred my account with no issues), I did notice that I had some personal issues with the User Interface. It‚Äôs not to say that the interface is terrible, but it is certainly lacking when you compare it to HBO Max‚Äôs UI. Selections are categorized by genre without a clear option for seeing selections from A-Z (it does have alphabetical order for genres, but it feels somewhat tedious to go through each genre to find what you‚Äôre looking for, especially if your choice is listed under multi genres). The service is also lacking dedicated pages for new titles and titles that are being cycled out of the service, and the section for titles leaving Max doesn‚Äôt notify you that the titles are leaving by the end of the month (I think a lot of people would appreciate having that feature on Max). Again, I still enjoy it, but I‚Äôd appreciate it if elements from HBO Max‚Äôs UI were reintroduced to Max.
Title: I enjoy the service, not so much the UI

Content: When Max first launched, it had issues. First of all, I use a Chromecast to cast it from my iPhone to my television. From the very beginning, I would have issues with it tracking my progress through a series. I would watch 3 episodes and when I came back to start again, it would start me halfway through the 2nd one I watched last time. Also, the ‚Äúnew episode‚Äù badge remains even after you have watched the new episode. Those were annoying, but not deal breakers. Now, though, my TV remote that used to pause a show no longer functions that way. Also, clicking into the show on my phone while it is casting to my TV no longer shows the progress bar like it used to‚Ä¶ so I can‚Äôt easily tell how long I have to go or how long a movie is. The latest development is that the pause button won‚Äôt even work on the phone now either. They only way I can pause the show is to disconnect from the Chromecast altogether.   I have detailed all these issues in previous reviews‚Ä¶ but strangely my 2 star reviews and complaints keep disappearing from the reviews list while the 4 and 5 star reviews remain. Maybe this one can actually stay up and people can get an honest view of the limitations of the app.
Title: Getting worse rather than better

Content: The Discovery Network now runs HBO, so with the new Max app came a bunch of commercial tv shows from the Discovery family. For those of us seeking HBO's content, we now have to sift through programming that we didn't sign up for like the pimple-popper cartoons and other tv programming owned by Discovery. It's cluttered the app substantially, heading in the direction of Netflix & Prime where they bury what you're looking for in order to push other shows at you. Not a fan of that. Whether using Max on Roku or a mobile device, there needs to be much more direct way to go straight to HBO programming only. My Home screen now features shark shows, children's shows, and other non-HBO shows - the shows I've been trying to get away from, which is why I have been subscribing to HBO for years. Conversely, people seeking Discovery content now have to sift through HBO shows. The app needs to better separate and categorize the content and make the channels simpler to directly access instead of trying to force feed me things I've got zero interest in.
Title: HBO great, but not the Discovery content

Content: Here‚Äôs s list of issues to fix, this is all related to apple TV ui, which feels like an afterthought - hero carousels are unusable, trying to use remote to go left and right on apple TV is too sensitive. It just scrolls by 2-3 slides when trying to see the next one - very buggy, I‚Äôve crashed it multiple times just digging thru the screens - all this new content, but its very hard to discover anything new - genre pages are a real mess, having a filter below the top thumbnails is annoying and affects top down scroll, top down scroll is very messy and meantime just resets to the top while in the middle of the page - can‚Äôt find all shows or all movies page, which makes discovery really hard, all i can do is poke in these lists - 2 navs top and left and they aren‚Äôt even consistent. Top disappears at times, left is totally useless. Old app has one left nave which worked well - hub pages are gone - show pages should allow thumbnails to peek through, instead you are shown ugly series list - overall there seems to be a lack of QA on the AppleTV app since it‚Äôs ridiculously easy to find bugs by spending 3 mins in the app - 10 ft UI should have been focused on discovery of content and bookmarking your favorite shows - Like the new hold add to watch list
Title: Lots of UI issues make it hard to use

Content: UPDATE: Months later, I‚Äôd hoped they had worked out the bugs so I could watch some favorites on my TV. I even tried subscribing through Roku instead of Apple, thinking maybe if I did it directly, it would work. Nope. It gave me an error message right away. üò£  I really enjoyed HBO Max, and regularly subscribed, but since the switch and all the screw ups and absolute frustration, I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll ever come back. I don‚Äôt want to watch on my computer or phone, which is the only place the app works. Would you all PLEASE put some time into fixing the app on Roku? There are a lot of us loyal Roku users out here who aren‚Äôt going to switch for your app.  *********************** It automatically signed me in on my phone, which is great, but it isn‚Äôt working at all on Roku. There‚Äôs no way to sign in online if you‚Äôre steaming through a Roku, so you have to key in all of your info, which is a pain. Then it kept saying ‚Äúsomething went wrong,‚Äù so I tried resetting my password. Still didn‚Äôt work. I tried restarting the Roku. Still didn‚Äôt work. Tried getting help through ‚Äúapp support,‚Äù and it doesn‚Äôt even offer Roku as an option! Plus you can‚Äôt even get a person on the chat. It‚Äôs all bots, which are clueless. Can I please have the HBO max app back? This one BLOWS.
Title: New app is horrible ‚Äî UPDATE: Still not working on Roku

Content: Why is there no recently played or continue watching in Apple TV app? Because they don‚Äôt care about the user experience. Actually it‚Äôs really on purpose. It‚Äôs a dark design pattern. They have dishonest executives and folks running the product team who want to manipulate you. It‚Äôs all about greed and hoping they get another month out of you. It‚Äôs the worst of capitalism. They want you to be frustrated. They hope you‚Äôll start a new show and lock you in further. End your subscription asap! Only subscribe when you want to watch something specific. Search only for that. And this isn‚Äôt just a Max (stupidest rebranding EVER) thing. This dark design pattern is on all the streaming apps. It‚Äôs gross. And the only way we can change it is to not fall for it! Cancel you subscriptions as soon as you can. Don‚Äôt forget you can cancel immediately after subscribing. You‚Äôll have a full month paid for. Subscribe again in a month if you want to continue watching. They hope you forget. Or that you get sucked into something else because you can‚Äôt find what you were just watching.  UPDATE:  oh wow! There is recently played. After force quitting the app. Something I bet less than 1000 people on planet earth know how to do on Apple TV. My dark design pattern argument stands.
Title: Dark design pattern

Content: I can‚Äôt really say much about the iPhone/iPad app, but the tv app we use for streaming since the update is absolutely horrible. Much more difficult to find content, and doesn‚Äôt save progress on what I‚Äôm watching anymore. I had to manually search for the series, then it didn‚Äôt save my progress even though I was 2 seasons and 4 episodes in. I added the show to ‚Äúmy stuff‚Äù hoping it would be the fix, but no. Please fix this glitch!   Update (6/6/23)‚Äîbut not changing my 1-star rating yet: I received a message from the developer asking if I‚Äôd like additional assistance. This would be helpful if the problem were with my account, but reading many other reviews, this issue is not a ‚Äúme‚Äù problem. I am appreciative they are taking the time to acknowledge the negative reviews but it seems that may have been somewhat of an automated response they could have sent to all 1 and 2-star reviews. There was a link to a form to send for advanced support, which I don‚Äôt feel is useful in this case, as I mentioned (don't worry, I did it anyway just to be safe), and a link to update my review, which is exactly what I‚Äôm doing here. Hopefully, though, it will lead to a speedy fox for all of us who seem to be having many of the same complaints!
Title: TV app since HBO Max changed to Max‚Ä¶

Content: HBO Max, or ‚ÄúMAX‚Äù, is probably the worst streaming application out there. It has various bugs on my smart TV and also the new iPad Pro. I used to pay for it and canceled it because I can‚Äôt stand how bad the application is. Then I got access to it again because it‚Äôs now included in my AT&T membership. I‚Äôm now contemplating about switching to another carrier so I can take this application out of my life, simply because of this one issue. It happens every other day; when I open the application, I have to connect my provider from scratch every single time.   This last time it was really infuriating. I downloaded a movie to watch while I‚Äôm traveling. Next, I‚Äôm traveling, and when I clicked on the application it asked me to connect my provider again. When I did it and went to downloads, it no longer showed the downloaded movie there. The funny part is the application still holds the space required for the movie, so it‚Äôs there, but I can‚Äôt watch it or delete it. I guess I needed a good excuse to delete the application altogether, and come here to write this rant. It‚Äôs a shame because I love HBO shows, but they must make their software product teams hate their lives to build an application like this.
Title: Too many unresolved bugs, the experience is not worth it.

Content: The app doesn‚Äôt allow you to see further into what is leaving, compared to in browser. Used to work on iPad in browser. They removed the option. The app also wont allow you to save some shows and movies. It is also not as easy to navigate. It also malfunctions when trying to fast forward or rewind parts. It‚Äôs an app and most apps are garbage. Don‚Äôt know why they made it app only. I also don‚Äôt want to waste space for another app. Clutter. Plus they made that awful show Velma, and never made a second season of peacemaker. One show, Velma, got the worse ratings of any show that ever existed. They say they are making another season. While peacemaker got amazing ratings. The people running this network are moronic dog crp trash. I will be canceling soon and will probably never come back as they have not added anything worth watching in awhile. Our flag means death season 2 might be worth a watch but that is is. Avenue five was a millions times better than that Velma crud. Does anyone know that the chick who wrote that ragged about sxually assaulting people on the conan show. Max wants to support that mindy puke. Nope. Go woke go broke. I hope this goes the way of bud light.
Title: Don‚Äôt like the app. Been adding bad content for a year or so now

Content: I really liked the HBO app, it was easy to use and you could have it on your phone or tv and it would stay logged in. I don‚Äôt like that the Max app keeps logging out from every device and to log back in takes forever. Customer service asked me one to talk to my provider but that it‚Äôs not issue. The problem is the Max app. I would be watching a show and out of the blue it would crash. When I try to log back in it would display an error message of can‚Äôt verify subscription. If I continue trying to log in, it would display a message to create an account. When I do create a new account it says I already have an account and still it will not log me in. last time I call customer service, they asked me to delete the app and reinstall it. It work for that time. They told me the issue won‚Äôt return and what do you know it log me out again. Even reinstalling the app several times did not work. It‚Äôs so frustrating! I‚Äôm spending more time trying to log in to the account than watching something. The only good thing about the max app is that it has good content, that I want to watch, but if I‚Äôm going to spend more time logging in than watching then what‚Äôs the point.
Title: App has log in issues

Content: Personally I loved HBO Max. Only place where you can get every season of South Park. I haven‚Äôt opened the new app, ‚ÄòMax‚Äô yet, but I will come back to edit my review. If this version has different resolutions for videos I will call in love. Edit: So far, LOVE that it transferred my data from HBO Max so that I didn‚Äôt have to log in. First star has been earned. I am happy with the avatar choices. I don‚Äôt really like the look of them, could be better, but the profile pictures are from my favorite shows, in fact multiple are. That‚Äôs a second star. Certain characters for the names that were previously supported in HBO Max are not supported in Max. I won‚Äôt deduct any stars though since as long as you don‚Äôt change your profile you can keep it. I like that all my shows moved with the new app. That‚Äôs a star. All seasons of south park are still there, that‚Äôs a star! I love the new loading animation, and that‚Äôs a fifth star. Good job on the app! Sad to see the iconic purple color leave the logo though.
Title: Review

Content: Every time I stream the app on my tv from my phone it glitches. For example, I‚Äôll put on a show I want to watch, put on an episode and it‚Äôll work after I exit out of the app. But as soon as I turn my phone on and go into the app it completely restarts the episode of the show on my tv. I cant turn up the volume of what im watching from in the app, I cant fast foward or rewind the episode without the entire episode starting over because I entered in the app. It‚Äôs especially annoying when I turn my phone and the last app I was on was HBO so it‚Äôll automatically restart after I enter my phone. The app has other glitches too, like not being able to turn the ‚Äúread aloud‚Äù subtitles off that talk over the entire show I‚Äôm watching. Sometimes the option to turn them off will be there, and sometimes it won‚Äôt. I have great internet connection, my cache is cleared for the app, I‚Äôve tested all the casting options on my tv, restarted my chrome casts, AND my Roku tvs, I deleted the HBO app and re-downloaded it but still the same problems. I‚Äôve been waiting over a month for a new update that might fix these bad bugs. But nothing has changed. This app does not work how it says it should.
Title: App has SERIOUS GLITCHES!

Content: HBO Max, or just ‚ÄúMax‚Äù as it‚Äôs now called for now reason, has completely removed its identity and all of its best features in a needless attempt to be a Netflix clone (this isn‚Äôt something you should be proud of HBO).   No longer can you upload custom profile photos, which were extremely helpful in our household. Now you‚Äôre stuck with generic character photos from different HBO shows and movies (the same exact way Netflix does it. The new blue design for the service/app makes it look just like Disney+ and Paramount now, making it more difficult to distinguish these services at a quick glance. The purple looked great, why change that? App layout and performance is debatable. The only thing I have experienced is that all the menus I was used to are now in different places and have been needlessly swapped around. On top of that, I had to go and download a completely separate app? Why not just update the original rather than give your users more steps than necessary?  Overall, pretty disappointed with this change and I hope HBO considers backing up some of these bizarre and uncomfortable ‚Äúimprovements‚Äù.
Title: One step forward, Two steps back

Content: I‚Äôve been an HBO subscriber since the early 1980s and am tickled to see the service that once offered Student Bodies and Revenge of the Nerds as feature events turn into a cutting edge producer of thoughtful and evocative pieces.  Sure, it‚Äôs easy to say Game of Thrones changed television (and I‚Äôm not doubting it‚Äôs impact) but the amazing representation in The Last of Us, Sex Lives of Teenage Girls, and Barry is remarkable. And the jewel in your crown that is Our Flag Means Death is your premiere offering. From diverse and thoughtful casting to inclusive story lines, to a writer‚Äôs room that reflects what‚Äôs really happening out here in the real world, it is a perfect slice of entertainment that I enjoy on my own as well as with my children. In turn, we have all recommended it far and wide as an exemplary example of diversity and inclusion in television. Max is doing it right with this one and should continue on this fine path they have forged through so many channels filled with hate and hypocrisy.  VERY WELL DONE!
Title: From boring to cutting edge

Content: I love the new max app for many many reasons. i used to have so many problems with the old hbo like it would always crash. i swear some days i couldn‚Äôt even watch my show because 4-5 minutes in the app would crash and not let me back on. i have to say that not having to deal with that brings me relief. another large improvement i‚Äôve seen all the new titles on Max. the first day i got on after the update and i was bewildered. so many choices of great movies and shows with DOUBLE the amount of streaming content. I also enjoy the new navigation menu. all of these changes have brought a new era to Max. But. I have an issue with how the home screen looks. i feel like that‚Äôs the only thing that didn‚Äôt change much and it looked almost identical to hbo max. i was hoping for some more vibrant colors or a new sleek and modern design when scrolling through what to watch. that‚Äôs been my only issue with the app so far. i love Max and i will continue to look forward to exciting new changes!
Title: Way better in lots of ways.

Content: HBO Max was, to me, the best streaming platform out there. It had a great design, a pleasant user experience, and was organized better than its competition. Max is like the little sibling that didn‚Äôt get enough attention from their parents. The calming purple of HBO Max has been replaced by a God-awful blue color that hurts my eyes whenever I look too long at the screen. (Seriously you could just keep the purple? It set Max apart from everything else!!) We no longer get Hubs, which was my favorite feature of HBO Max. Now we have an ugly top menu with only a couple options. Navigating the app for the first time on the tv nearly broke me as the app kept fighting me when I wanted to navigate away from the top menu and back to the featured content. It‚Äôs honestly what I expected from the Discovery merger. There was so much potential here but it looks like Discovery wanted to rip out the guts of HBO Max and ship this as fast as possible. The result is an ugly, difficult to use mess. I have to double click to unpause content now. Peacock does that and before this app came out it was my least favorite streaming service. Also deeplinking into your shows doesn‚Äôt work on Google TV.
Title: The Worst Version of its Predecessors

Content: This app has changed my life, as if Jesus touched his soft warm hands on my shoulder and fixed all my issues. I love the fact that the shuffle button has been removed. At first I was mad, as the only thing I watch on HBO‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.WAIT IM SORRY! The only thing I watch on MAX‚Ä¶‚Ä¶is South Park. That‚Äôs it. I‚Äôve seen every episode multiple times and my depressed autistic husk of a body needs familiarity after suffering through the day. But you know what? Screw it! Lets make using this app more inconvenient and remove a cool feature for no reason! That is Steve Jobs level on innovation . Whoever‚Äôs GENIUS thought that was deserves a raise and a nice back running because GOD KNOWS HES HAD A STRESSFUL WORK FILLED DAY! This is the best thing man kind has ever created it truly is a work of art and I LOVE MAX. MAX IS MY FAVORITE. MAX IS LOVE, MAX IS LIFE! I PLEDGE MYSELF TO YOUR TEACHINGS MAX,
Title: The greatest update of all time, only god himself could perform such a miracle

Content: Hi, I‚Äôve had hbo max for a long time now, but ever since the new update to max, it‚Äôs had a lot of bugs. Before the update I‚Äôd finish a series and be able to restart it from the start without playing at the ends of episodes. Also while it goes to the next episode, as well as starting from the end, it wil now sometimes close the app on the tv out. Additionally, it won‚Äôt save series under currently watching if they had been watched before and when restarted it still doesn‚Äôt save it. Not sure why these bugs are now here but hope they get fixed soon. It‚Äôs become almost impossible to watch as well as a lot of the cartoon series are being dropped and some missing episodes. Like Clarence is now gone and regular show is missing episodes. I thought Cartoon Network was bought out by whoever ultimately is over the Warner brothers shows but now they are disappearing after getting them so that doesn‚Äôt make sense. Not sure why but hope all these problems, and series get back soon. Thank you, I really appreciate it.
Title: New update has many bugs

Content: Update: I reported it to Max using the link in the developer response before they responded to me. Not a great sign that they‚Äôre listening to any of this criticism.   Original: Max also does away with the side menu hub. Now you have to scroll to get to the hubs. This is significantly less convenient than HBO Max, with its side menu hubs. Max doesn‚Äôt do personalized recommendations like HBO Max used to do. It just recommends the things it spent a lot of money on line And Just Like That, Friends, and South Park. Max doesn‚Äôt allow you to not play the next episode. If you back out of the auto play countdown when it starts, the rest of the episode will play, but the back button no longer works until the next episode starts. All the reality TV garbage I never wanted and never watch now clutters the app while browsing it. HBO Max used to be the app I could browse and find something I wanted to watch. I can‚Äôt do that in this app. Too much garbage content in a garbage layout. It also did away with the native Apple TV player, so now we have to do things like turn off subtitles when they randomly turn on and press twice to go back or forward instead of once.
Title: So irritating, I hate using the app

Content: I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs wrong with this app? The previous HBO max app had a whole host of problems, and some of them have been resolved here. However, the new app seems to have introduced a bunch of new problems. We have a TV with Chromecast, so casting the app from my phone is the only way to watch HBO on our TV. The app constantly loses its place in whatever show we‚Äôre watching. Anytime we pause the show for a bathroom break and come back, the show starts from an entirely different spot that we‚Äôve already watched (sometimes starting from a previous episode). Then, we have to search for the spot we were at, and the scrubbing doesn‚Äôt show thumbnails of the current screen as I search. It‚Äôs a big game of guess and check, and each time I guess, I have to wait 15 seconds for the show to load before finding out if I‚Äôve guessed correctly. Sometimes if the app is feeling especially spiteful, it will throw an error and log me out completely. There‚Äôs also no ‚Äúskip recap‚Äù or ‚Äúskip intro‚Äù button when casting from the phone which is just annoying. Why create an entirely new app if it‚Äôs no better than the last? Just frustrating
Title: Worse than the previous app

Content: I see plenty of reviews complaining about the app not loading or installing on tvs and crashing tvs along with crashing other apps.. for me personally, I have two tvs, a Hisense 55‚Äù google tv and a Samsung 50‚Äù google tv that when I opened the HBO Max app I was prompted to download the new MAX app which was downloaded and installed on both tvs just fine. Both tvs opened the app with my account Information already switched over and logged in, both tvs had all my profiles on them ready to select and open just fine, both tvs also play everything in the content including the new SHAZAM movie. It is also nice having quite a bit of added content from Discovery+ to view as well, however my one gripe is that the Samsung tv does run really slow in the app and the quality constantly suffers due to that, in movies and/or tv shows even though that tv is newer, higher quality and closer to the WiFi router. Otherwise no other complaints so far. Happy viewing!
Title: Mostly Hit, Unfortunate Miss..

Content: I love the selection of movies and shows so much that MAX has become my most-used streaming app lately. The only downside would be the bugs while using the app on my iPhone. Sometimes when I open the app and start a new episode, I‚Äôll watch the ads and then realize I can‚Äôt pause, close, or do anything with the app. My only choice is to lock my phone and re-open the app. Then my episode starts over and I have to watch ads again. Shows will sometimes start playing out of nowhere when I connect Bluetooth, plug in my charger, answer calls, or unlock my phone, even when the app is just operating in the background. The last bummer is that I have to sign in way more often now. No one uses my account but me, so it‚Äôs a little frustrating to enter my credentials so often. That said though, the rest of the experience is great and it‚Äôs overall worth it. I especially like that more TV episodes have a single long ad at the beginning so there is no interruption in the middle!
Title: Great Selection but Some Bugs

Content: As of writing this, a couple days after HBO Max became ‚ÄúMax,‚Äù I need to state that this new app / change needs a lot of work. After I launched the app on my cell phone & on my TV, a Roku device, the first issue that appeared was my ‚ÄúContinue Watching‚Äù no longer had shows I was watching & listed movies that I had finished watching & removed from my list. When I searched for the show I was watching, it was not appearing but when I searched for them on my Roku device, it read the show was on ‚ÄúMax‚Äù & when I selected it, it led me to the show on the streaming service. The inconsistency is the first issue. The second & biggest is the audio is out of sync on my shows. There is at least a 5 second delay with the audio when I was able to begin watching my show. The out of sync is also with the searching & selecting process itself. This new version needs a lot of refining.  Update: thank you for the response to my review, I troubleshooted the app on all my devices & followed the link provided & it did fix the issue I was experiencing.
Title: The new ‚ÄúMax‚Äù needs work

Content: I know it seems harsh docking 2 stars for organization but I haven‚Äôt fully explored the rest of the app so I don‚Äôt know if there‚Äôs anything else wrong. Anything else I might politely object to. The reason I haven‚Äôt fully is because from what I can tell it just has ‚Äútv‚Äù, ‚Äúmovies‚Äù, ‚Äúhbo‚Äù, ‚Äúnew & notable‚Äù. Whereas the old HBO Mac organization and menu format was more extensive than just the standard Netflix-esque ‚Äúwe‚Äôve separated tv and movies, now scroll‚Äù. The things mentioned in the app description at the time of this comment was, not necessarily in this order, ‚ÄúDC Universe‚Äù, ‚ÄúHarry Potter‚Äù, ‚ÄúFood Network‚Äù, ‚ÄúMagnolia Network‚Äù, ‚ÄúTLC‚Äù, ‚ÄúHGTV‚Äù, ‚ÄúAdult Swim‚Äù, and ‚ÄúHBO‚Äù. However, it‚Äôs only ‚ÄúTV‚Äù, ‚ÄúMovies‚Äù, ‚ÄúHBO‚Äù, and ‚Äúnew‚Äù. Where this is going is. Is there a way to separate all of those networks/franchises and other stuff (like cartoons and other stuff) in a tab system similar to the old one? Like how other apps and the old version did? Not the same obviously, but similar. A new app doesn‚Äôt mean everything has to be different.
Title: Organization system needs work.

Content: The whole rollout of Hbo Max‚Äôs new ‚ÄúMax‚Äù platform is an absolute joke. First off, on launch day Max wasn‚Äôt even available on my Roku TV. Tried to google how to make it work but the internet doesn‚Äôt know what Max is, only what HBO Max is so all troubleshooting for ‚Äúmax‚Äù was useless. Waited for them to fix all their disastrous errors and tried to log in the next day. All of a sudden my password is not correct and to update my password I used the web address provided on my tv screen. Each time on the web address you clicked Sign In it would take you to the App Store to download the Max app. Once the app was downloaded I proceeded to attempt sign in using the forgot password option, it emailed a link that I then updated my Password ON A WEB BROWSER!! What did I need the app for? This whole thing is completely not worth even having the service anymore and even though it‚Äôs minor in the grand scheme of life, in the moment it was frustrating enough for me to consider cancelling my subscription that‚Äôs increasing in price anyway with this new rollout. Cool. Thanks, Max. üëéüèº
Title: Whoever decided Max should be a thing needs to be fired.

Content: There's a lot more stuff on the channel since the rebrand to Max, but poor layout and navigation decisions have made it difficult to wade through all the crap to find something worth watching. More is not better, it's just more, kinda like cable. (And they have removed some things.) Finally, the flashy start-up graphics ignore my iPad's reduce motion settings. They are painful to watch. Might be time to drop this app until those who thoughtlessly mandated this poor reinvention of the wheel get their act together. Update: now I'm getting emails to request participation in a survey. Are they using a new team that has no access to the years of customer interactions that went into the development of this app's forerunners? I don't like wasting my time simply because a company doesn't value the institutional memory of its previous development teams. A lot could also be improved by focusing on best practices when it comes to user interfaces and accessibility.  UPDATE: I do not want CNN in this app. I don't open it for news. Yuk.
Title: Max Mishmash

Content: HBOMax was classy, well organized, easy on the eyes, and a great app. Performance suffered in recent months, I assume as the Max app was being developed. The blue is obnoxious. The removal of recaps of prior episodes of TV shows stinks (make it an option if you want to do that, but those recaps added so much to the experience in setting up the episode). Worst, when watching minimized, the jump to the next episode drops out the player entirely. I can literally spend 12 hours with your app playing. Switching back to the main app constantly in that time is obnoxious & HBOMax did not work that way; even more ridiculous, if I don‚Äôt switch right away, the show may start playing in the background with no player visible(!) & that next episode startup may happen immediately OR even 30 minutes later, out of the blue! The new UI is the pits - ugly color, bad organization. And you dropped the HBO name which was the best connotation there was for denoting quality. (Cine)Max has no class & never has. What were you thinking‚Ä¶
Title: HBO downgrade to Max

Content: Did you subscribe for sports and news shows?  I did not.  But they come up first on my Home Screen. So now I am wasting time trying to search for a show that interests me. There are other streaming providers. They can not even suggest shows based upon what you have watched in the past. This is retained I formation. So what is the issue? They have mixed together many different classifications from science to children's to comedy, adult anime to fantasy to war movies in same category. I have love stories and ancient history in same category. Terribly disappointed that they are unable to get this together. An AI Chatbot would do better. They have many excellent programs, finding them is really hard now that they have combined so many different types of programs under 1 classification. I frequently give up and go someplace else. HBO used to be famous for their series. They mixed up series from every channel they carry now. They have made their streaming service as difficult as they could to watch. Very disappointing customer experience.
Title: Terrible User Interface to Search

Content: Why did you do this. HBO max was leagues ahead of all other streaming platforms, and not just in terms of content but in terms of the interface design. For some reason y‚Äôall took out the little things that made it great. Seeing the writing/producing/directing credits underneath an episode, being able to click on a specific episode and it having its own page, custom profile pictures, genres of movies having their own pages (now you have to go to ‚Äúmovies‚Äù then you scroll around until you find the genre you want). Y‚Äôall even made the color scheme more basic and lame, PURPLE WAS SO MUCH BETTER. And on top of all this you removed the HBO from your name which is just stupid. I just don‚Äôt understand how you can have a perfectly find product then just ruin it for absolutely no reason. Companies need to realize they don‚Äôt need to make meaningless changes every 3 years, everyone was fine with HBO max.
Title: Y‚Äôall had something and then you ruined it

Content: I loathe this app. I wasn't a huge HBO stan but I liked it, it had a good interface, and I could always find something good to watch. Now there's a ton more content and it's impossible to find anything good. The user interface is one of the absolute worst. I'm looking at the four shows on my for you suggestions right now...2 are shows I absolutely loathe, shows I never would watch and consider it part of my personality to hate, one is a show I actively hate but not top 5 things I hate and the other is The Gilded Age that they're promoting everywhere. There's no thumbs down, no thumbs up, no way to improve recommendations. Just a massive trove of content that's impossible to filter through and they make sure the worst garbage is always at the top. I have no idea what this streamer even is anymore. There's no brand identity. It's become a few amazing high quality jewels in a vast sea of garbage and they make you work really hard to find the good stuff. Are they already doing MBA case studies on the epic value distruction that Max is?
Title: Destroyed one of the best brands of all time

Content: I am a new subscriber who was drawn to this service because of its link to CNN beginning in latter September.  But I can honestly say that even before the streaming launch of CNN begins that I am truly enjoying Max‚Äôs existing selection of TV and film choices!  Plus I was able to drop my subscription to Discovery Plus since so many TV  programs are duplicated on Max, thus saving me money.  My only wish is that Max would offer more reality dating shows from all countries as, embarrassing as it is, I am hooked on them!    I cannot  wait to watch some form of CNN again since cutting my cable cord, especially with the 2024 presidential election coming up.   I may be in the minority based on their dismal ratings, but I still find CNN interesting and thought provoking.  Hurray to Max for bringing them to a streaming format!
Title: Love it!

Content: App functionality continues to get worse with every update unfortunately (using an updated iPhone 13). Casting is next to impossible: episodes will re-start randomly while you are watching them, volume will max out, and your episode progress won‚Äôt be saved. Casting also lacks a ‚Äúskip intro‚Äù button which is sub-standard for streaming apps.   Apart from casting, if you try to re-watch a series, or jump around episodes, your progress will not be saved under ‚Äúcontinue watching‚Äù on the home page. This forces you to manually search the show you were watching every time, guess what episode you were on, and guess how far in you were. Extremely inconvenient.   Restarting phone, signing out, deleting app, updating app, updating phone, and using different types of casting devices (smart TV, chrome cast, etc) do not resolve any of these issues. I‚Äôll have to forgo the mobile app entirely and use the website until they fix this app‚Ä¶
Title: Latest Update Renders Casting Impossible

Content: HBO went from HBO to HBO Go to HBO Now to HBO MAX to just MAX. I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs happening here but the latest update has made their steaming app the worst thing ever. Rewind, fast forward and even the pause function is horrible. Forget wanting to run back without having to escape the whole thing. I hate this new format and literally want to cancel my service and stop using it. I don‚Äôt know who‚Äôs genius idea it was to take something that worked just fine and totally change it. The ‚Äústart from beginning‚Äù option is gone, the subtitle function is more difficult to use now and the user experience has gone from a 9 to a zero. Instead of rewinding properly you just get a sound that makes it seem like something is happening but nothing is‚Ä¶ I have to think they‚Äôll change it back to how it functioned before but nowadays people just change things for absolutely no reason. Maybe someone there just needed something to do. There‚Äôs literally nothing good about it. Zero improvements and nothing but problems.
Title: Worst update of all time

Content: I downloaded a few episodes of a show to watch on a flight. Less than 12 hours later (after confirming that they had been completely downloaded) they were just gone. Made for a boring flight. Instead of making a brand new app with the same problems, consider fixing the issues that just don‚Äôt ever go away. The app is also eternally incapable of remembering where I am in an episode or even which episode I‚Äôm on whether I watch in on my computer, iPad, or Apple TV. This is your only choice to watch HBO shows, it‚Äôs just bad. Update: The developer reached out to offer ‚Äúhelp‚Äù which was just a link to the downloads page. I understand very clearly that downloads are valid for thirty days after download and for 48 hours after they are started. The developer clearly didn‚Äôt take the time to read that the downloaded shows did not last for even 12 hours. Two star rating stays because this is a very badly designed and managed application.
Title: New app, same low quality

Content: I‚Äôm not real sure what the issue was with HBOMAX app but I was good with it.  The ratings that I‚Äôve been reading on here have been high for this new app.  I will give it props for the amount of content.  That is a nice improvement.  I gave it a 3 star because if I watch a new show or any show for that matter, when I stop, I expect to be able to come back to pick up where I left off.  This new app doesn‚Äôt even remember that I watched the show at all, let alone which episode I stopped at.  That is frustrating.  I have been spoiled with all other streaming apps remembering and the prior app remembered.  If we can make a request for an update to the app, I request to give the app the ability to remember where I left off at with TV series.  It seems to remember movies just fine.   I mainly watch it on my ROKU device and I have a ROKU tv.  I know a lot of people said the issue was only on the Apple TV devices but my ROKU doesn‚Äôt remember either.
Title: I miss HBOMax

Content: I was excited about the new launch from HBO Max to MAX and seeing what new exclusive content was available, plus they have most of the shows from Discovery+ so now that‚Äôs some money I get to save each month when I cancel my discovery+ subscription. All of this however doesn‚Äôt matter a bit anymore because MAX doesn‚Äôt want to play nice with Apple TV üò° This means that everything in my ‚Äúcontinue watching‚Äù on the Max app won‚Äôt be on my Apple TV Up Next the instant I turn my tv on. This also means that if a movie pops into my head and I want to search it using Siri from my Apple TV, I won‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs available on MAX or not before I rent it or buy it through Apple because MAX decided they just weren‚Äôt going to share their info with Apple like they‚Äôve been doing with HBO Max for years!!  It shouldn‚Äôt be this much of a hassle for customers who pay over $100 a year to be able to access the content they pay for! Seriously this needs to be fixed for the transition to MAX to be worthy of more than 1 star
Title: Content‚Äôs great, HORRIBLE for connecting to TV!!!!

Content: I can‚Äôt connect my provider (xfinity) on my phone at all. When I select the Xfinity provider it takes me to the xfinity home page, then I click the sign in option manually and I essentially just login to Xfinity‚Äôs account website as if I was using a browser - it does nothing to communicate back to the Max app that I‚Äôve signed in and am ready to watch. I selected the ‚Äúremember me on this device‚Äù option so that when I press back several times and re-select ‚ÄúXfinity‚Äù as my provider, it automatically logs me in, shows the green check mark, and then shows the users on the account like it should when I log in - but I‚Äôm still on the pop-up browser screen, not in the Max app interface. When I select myself as the user, nothing happens, I‚Äôm just stuck on that page. And then when I click ‚Äúcancel‚Äù, the pop up screen closes and it says ‚Äúerror‚Äù on the max app. I‚Äôve gone through the Max help directions and none of them solve the problem - the app is truly useless to me. Thanks ‚ÄúMAX‚Äù.
Title: Xfinity Provider Login does not work

Content: It‚Äôs basically HBO Max but worse. I will be watching a show and when I want it to auto-play the next episode (or when I will click the button that is supposed to lead to the next episode), it comes up with a ‚ÄúSomething Went Wrong‚Äù screen and I have to go home and then click on the show from there. It‚Äôs not a problem on my end given I can simply play the episode from the home screen directly after. I like to lounge in bed after a long day and let the shows play, but now I have to go back and leave the show whenever I want to play the next episode. This never happened on HBO Max, just this app.  On another note, ‚ÄúHBO Max‚Äù just sounded better. If you say ‚ÄúHBO Max,‚Äù people know what you‚Äôre talking about. They know it‚Äôs a streaming service. ‚ÄúMax‚Äù doesn‚Äôt mean anything. If you say ‚ÄúMax,‚Äù people aren‚Äôt going to know hat you‚Äôre talking about ‚Äî they‚Äôll think you‚Äôre just using the word as a normal word, not that you‚Äôre talking about a streaming service. It wasn‚Äôt necessary to change a perfectly fine name.
Title: Doesn‚Äôt Work As Well As HBO MAx

Content: This app is one of the best streaming services, the originals are good, the amount of other stuff is also great. But since the Max update all my shows that I was watching were wiped from my continue watching and now I have no clue where i‚Äôm at on a ton of different shows. Not only that, any shows I am watching will only show up in my watch later sometimes and when they do it‚Äôs usually not on the episode I left off on? Idk why it started happening or if it‚Äôs just my account that it‚Äôs happening to but it‚Äôs really annoying. Also if I pause in the middle of an episode and go watch something else or close the app, the next time I go to watch that episode it will completely start over and I have to skip back to where I was.  I really hope this gets fixed because other than that it‚Äôs pretty much my favorite streaming app.
Title: Love it but..

Content: HBO MAX is an extensive streaming platform with a vast and impressive collection of content. From popular HBO series like Game of Thrones and Westworld to cult classics like Friends and The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, HBO MAX offers a diverse range of TV shows and movies.  The user interface of HBO MAX is sleek and user-friendly, making it easy for even first-time users to navigate and find the content they want to watch. The search bar is intuitive and works well to find specific titles without fuss.  One notable feature of HBO MAX is its section of original content, featuring unique and innovative programs like Lovecraft Country, Raised by Wolves, and Euphoria. These shows are not only entertaining but also tackle important social and cultural issues, making them stand out from other streaming platforms.  One downside of HBO MAX is that it is a bit on the expensive side compared to other streaming services, but its extensive content library and original programming make it a worthwhile investment for fans of HBO shows and movies.  Overall, HBO MAX is an excellent and impressive streaming service that offers a diverse range of content and has a well-designed user interface. It's definitely worth a try if you're a fan of HBO's productions.
Title: BEST APP EVER!!

Content: I have the latest Roku Ultra and this new Max App is extremely sluggish. Every press of the button is a 2 to 3 second wait. That may not seem like much but none of the other streaming apps I use have this issue.  My major complaint is that when you watch a TV series after you finish an episode it thinks you finished the series and removes it from  the continued watching list. When you go to the series to pick up where you left off, it only allows you to restart the entire series. You have to then manually scroll to find the last episode you were watching and fast forward through it to the end to get to the actual episode you wanted to watch. This is too frustrating to do after every episode.  I have never experienced any of these things in the old app or any other app for that matter. I also have zero interest in any of the reality shows they added. They have definitely lost me as customer. After my annual subscription for HBOMax expires I will cancel their service.
Title: Horrible App

Content: I'm having some issues with my downloads, they don't display after I close the app. I tried re-downloading the same episode and after checking my iPhone storage I find that it has actually downloaded twice. I have tried deleting the app and re-downloading the apps and still have the same issues. I have provided a screenshot of my iPhone storage to show that episode one of "the last of us" has been downloaded twice, but after closing the app and re-opening the app the episode has disappeared from my download list. I live in a rural area so my downloads are very important to me for entertainment, we don't have a lot of cellular service and home Internet is not cheap in this area. These issues I am having now are the same issues that I had before with the previous app before this new app came out and ended my subscription because of it, if this issue isn't resolved I will do so again very soon.
Title: No better than the last app

Content: In one way very frustrated with the new app and out of that frustration wanted to give one star and maybe even two is too low. However, the frustration of finding something new is very big. Use to get on and go to just added and see what was just added. The new avatar movie is on and get a pop up showing it‚Äôs there, but it‚Äôs not in just added. It‚Äôs still showing the same thing for the last week. I really enjoyed it before the change. Now it reminds me of a couple other platforms where I feel they are trying to hide the new stuff. I could check every day and see if something new was out. Now I just don‚Äôt feel like having to dig or think there isn‚Äôt anything new and wonder if it‚Äôs even worth it. The new app seems to function better on my tv at least. Never had a problem on my phone before, so not sure that makes up for much. I really hope you can resolve this. Thank you for your time
Title: Miss the old HBO max app

Content: I loved HBO Max. It had the tv shows and movies I loved, making it my go to app throughout the day. However, since they‚Äôve rebranded, the quality of the app is completely gone. I‚Äôm no longer able to continuing watching shows or movies. The continue watching tab disappears once the app is closed. I‚Äôve had to scroll through movies and shows on multiple occasions just to find where I left off. I‚Äôve tried uninstalling, reinstalling, closing the app, and creating a new profile but nothing has worked. What‚Äôs worse is that Max isn‚Äôt even acknowledging the problem.  Im at a point of cancelling the service until they fix their issues. There was no need to make changes to the functionality of their app, but whatever they changed broke it. I realize this is a small problem when you‚Äôre looking at the big picture, but I don‚Äôt want to pay for something that isn‚Äôt going to work. Not recommending to anyone until this issue is acknowledged and fixed.
Title: The rebranding has ruined it

Content: The new MAX app looks very nice, they simplified it down and made it look so much more clean and smooth, usually people don‚Äôt like it when companies simplify their brand but how the new MAX app did it is very nice and I appreciate the work they put into. Another thing I want to point out is how the new MAX app can finally play movies/shows while off the app, what I mean is how you can get off the app and still watch the thing you were watching and do other things on your phone at the same time, I love this new addition because I multitask a lot and a lot of my favorite shows were on HBO max and now I can watch them on the go on the go? Lol, but actually I really appreciate the new app and I don‚Äôt think it deserves the hate it‚Äôs getting right now.
Title: My review on the new HBO max app

Content: I personally love max. I have all of the shows and movies that I ever wanted to watch right here. Personally, if I had to pick one streaming service to use it would be Max. Always great movies and t.v. shows, and they always have a fresh variety of shows and movies too!! I went onto Max, and they had so many of the great movies and t.v. shows that you would find on other streaming plate forms. IF you don‚Äôt have Max, then you need to download and get it, because if you don‚Äôt, then you are missing out on some of the coolest movies and t.v. shows around!!! I LOVE MAX and will always love it. Good job to the makers of Max, but also the people who run it and keep it working like it should, great job you guys to making the best steaming service around!!!! üòäüòäüòä
Title: The the best reasons to have, or to keep Max!!

Content: I feel like I‚Äôve already mentioned this since the new Apple TV app was released.. I have the HD Apple TV and the sound on the former HBO TV app was among the best sound of all the streaming apps but ever since they changed their name and crossed over to the new app the sound has been pretty low and awful.. No high and low separation, it never seems to be in surround, even on brand new releases and I have to turn the volume up to 70 just to understand the dialogue and then sometimes a sound effect will come on and wake the neighbors but mostly it‚Äôs just flat sounding. Older movies on the max app can be even worse sounding. There‚Äôs definitely been a downgrade in the sound quality even though they claim to have all these great surround codecs. I have a Sonos surround system that used to sound great with the former HBO TV app and I could easily understand the dialogue even when on level 25 instead of 70.ü§®
Title: The sound is horrible and low quality on new TV appüò´

Content: Hello  I am currently on a family vacation, during which I decided to download HBO content for offline viewing. To my surprise, the downloaded movies my kids were enjoying suddenly became unavailable today. According to the app, these downloads expire after either 28 days or 48 hours from the first viewing.  Our current location is an extremely remote area with minimal cell service, relying on EDGE or 3G when available. It has taken considerable effort to find a spot where I can even write this review. Furthermore, there is no Wi-Fi access here, as we are situated in a mountainous town that is approximately two hours away from reliable cell coverage.  Initially, I presumed that the HBO app merely required a revalidation of the download by connecting to the servers. Thus, I tethered my iPad to my phone, but to my disappointment, it started attempting to download the entire movie again.  While I understand that contractual agreements with studios can influence content availability, it is worth noting that some of the content in question is owned by HBO/AT&T, indicating that these restrictions were implemented internally for reasons unknown to me.  In contrast, competing streaming platforms such as Netflix do not impose similar limitations. I suggest considering a thorough review of the features offered by your competitors, as I am now inclined to choose Netflix over HBO due to these download restrictions.  Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Title: Offline on vacation

Content: This is one of my favorite networks and I‚Äôm mostly reviewing the app for TV, not mobile devices. Since the transition from HBO Max to Max, everything I watch through the TV app has been sticky and glitchy. For example, I‚Äôm currently watching a show. When I hit pause, then play to start again, the show reverts to the very beginning or goes back three scenes, instead of picking up where it left off. It also freezes and crashes on a very regular basis and sometimes doesn‚Äôt remember shows I‚Äôm watching so I can continue watching them.. I hope this is just all part of growing pains, and that the current bugs will be squashed as new versions get updated. I‚Äôm also so bummed that I can‚Äôt choose my own avatars. I used to have cute photos of the users in my home and now I‚Äôm being forced to select from cartoon characters that I know nothing about.
Title: Oof

Content: Every time I cast from my phone to my TV, the HBO app automatically equips whatever I‚Äôm watching with ‚Äúdescription English audio‚Äù and it plays over top of the audio of the show I‚Äôm watching, it‚Äôs very distracting‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs not an accessibility thing I need. When I open the settings on my phone to turn the descriptive audio off, it doesn‚Äôt even display it as an option. Every once in a while, it‚Äôll do the same thing, but get stuck in a different language and won‚Äôt even allow me to turn the subtitles on to cope with it I can watch the show on my phone just fine, but the problem arises when I project it to my TV. currently I don‚Äôt have a remote for my TV‚Ä¶ So I can‚Äôt just open up Max on my TV and play it there but I imagine that‚Äôs gonna be a problem then too‚Ä¶ This app is a mess, no idea why y‚Äôall would switch to a whole new app with whole new problems, but it‚Äôs really really frustrating and I‚Äôm thinking I‚Äôll cancel my subscription.
Title: Audio Bug is driving me CRAZY

Content: UPDATED REVIEW:  Within an hour, the bugs had been resolved. Either they were already working on the issue or saw my review(or a lot similar reviews with the same issue) and now app is working perfectly. Thank you!  Not happy at all with th recent update‚Ä¶when resuming an episode it won‚Äôt pickup where you left off, no‚Ä¶.it will start over. Every time. So now I have to make note of how far along in an episode I am if I have to stop an episode and exit out of the app. Also, episode progress bar(to show how many episodes you‚Äôve watched) is not showing. These two features are vital for a streaming app and are not working at all. This goes for the app AND Max through Roku tv.
Title: Recent Bugs are Annoying

Content: I‚Äôve been using the app on iPhone, iPad, and roku for about a month and I will cancel as soon as I‚Äôm done watching a few more shows. Transitioning between the previously mentioned devices is not smooth and I constantly have to remember where I left off on the previous device and fast-forward on a new device since the app can‚Äôt seem to remember.  After pausing a playback, it might start where you paused it, it might go back 10 seconds, it might go back 20 minutes‚Ä¶ you never know what it‚Äôs going to do.  And the ‚ÄúFor You‚Äù section is a joke. Stuff I would never watch, but there is no option to remove the suggestion, or to like/dislike something to improve the suggestions. I‚Äôm also writing this review when the playback decided to stop, which it does often. I have to go back to the main screen and restart the show from there for it to start again.
Title: Not worth the price

Content: The previous HBO app was wonderful. I don‚Äôt like anything about the new app, aside from it having all HBO content.  Which is also a part of my problem with it. To much content. It just doesn‚Äôt seem very well organized to have to navigate through SO much content that I have no interest in, before I stumble across something I want to watch.  I think the fast forward/rewind in 10 second increments is extremely slow, compared to other apps and including the old HBO, which was great. Not sure if it‚Äôs do to all the additional media, but it‚Äôs just very slow. I also do NOT like that the progress bar only shows time remaining in a program, as opposed to also including time watched, like it use too.  I also get a lot of blank black screen issues if I fast forward. A program will start just fine, but if I fast forward through the opening credits, only the audio will work, as the video just drops completely out to a pitch black screen. That happened on Very Rare Occasions on the old app, maybe once a month or longer. With the new app it‚Äôs almost daily. So I constantly have to reboot my Apple TV device. I suppose it could be a compatibility issue with the Apple TV, but the old app didn‚Äôt have that problem.   Those are just a few issues I have with MAX. I wish I could go back to the old HBO MAX!  Disappointing
Title: MAX vs HBO MAX

Content: First off, the branding is ugly and the blue light is absolutely blinding when it comes on my TV. Secondly, why inconvenience your customers by making them download a completely different app, and if you plan on doing that, why not make the app work properly before launching it??? The app crashes constantly across all platforms, freezes nonstop, it‚Äôs harder to find what I‚Äôm looking for, and my biggest problem with Max (other than the fact that it freezes and crashes every time I try to use it) is: when I try to rewatch episodes of a show I‚Äôve seen all the episodes of, the show is no longer in my continue watching, no matter how many times I restart it. And when I play an episode, every single time, it starts at the very end instead of the beginning, causing me to have to back out and press restart, which usually causes the app to crash. Such a horrible idea executed in the worst way.
Title: Everything about the switch to Max was a mistake.

Content: Garbage app from garbage monster David Zaslav. This thing never remembers what I was watching or which episodes I already watched. It also keeps taking me back to the top of the home page rather than where I was in the home page so I have to keep finding everything over and over. Titles that start with ‚ÄúA‚Äù or ‚ÄúThe‚Äù are filed under ‚ÄúA‚Äù and ‚ÄúT‚Äù because the people who made this app are dimwits. And it no longer tells you the writer and director. It just has some vague label that says ‚ÄúCreators‚Äù and then just lists a bunch of names in random order and you don‚Äôt know who did what. This is because Zaslav hates creatives and wants to muddy the waters between scripted and unscripted. And there needs to be an option so that none of those awful Discovery shows ever appear on my home screen. This merger has absolutely ruined Warner Bros and what was once  very respectable streaming service with an amazing library of content. Fix this garbage app, fire David Zaslav, and pay your writers!
Title: Terrible app

Content: HBO is responding to the complaints about its app not saving the most recent progress of a watched show or movie by asking the consumer to ‚Äúreach out‚Äù so they can help. That would be great if this were something that was happening on the consumer‚Äôs side of things, but this is a bug in the app that needs fixing on the developer‚Äôs side.  I watch the MAX app on Roku. I‚Äôm sorry, but if your app can‚Äôt reliably remember the last show I watched, what episode I was on, and where in the episode I left off, why would I even continue paying for your service? The HBO Max app did not have these problems, but your new app doesn‚Äôt even add what I‚Äôm watching to my continue watching list most times. Weirdly, sometime‚Äôs my progress is there and other times the show isn‚Äôt even available in my continue watching list. I have updated the app on every device yet the problem remains.   How about you guys fix this instead of putting the responsibility onto the consumer?
Title: Terrible App

Content: I really don‚Äôt like the new app. The old one was pretty good, and it actually had a usable, recognizable name. Now it just seems like some dumb conglomerate of companies, like Disney but kinda stupid. Just call it what it is, HBO.  In terms of acquiring it, I had no idea they changed until HBO Max told me it doesn‚Äôt work anymore and to get the new app, so I did. Luckily, everything moved over without me even having to put in a password or anything, which is great because I‚Äôm using someone else‚Äôs account, but not so great for your security.  Now, for the app itself, it has some glitches, just a couple little things that make me instantly upset that I had to change apps, but they‚Äôre mostly minor bugs that could probably be patched in the next update. Still, not happy.  I give it two stars cause I wanted to give it one because I don‚Äôt like change, but I‚Äôm being generous in that the app itself works alright.
Title: Ugh

Content: Apart from the fact that they released a buggy app that won‚Äôt even allow you to log in, this app does not seem to perform any better than their previous app. It‚Äôs hard to tell if they released this app as a joke or a serious effort to fix their extremely poor performance with the previous one. Will have to wait and see if this is more than just a cosmetic fix.  Edit: After using it for a few days I‚Äôm changing my ratings. After the last update, this app seems to perform much better than their previous app. The UI/UX is still not good. For example, when I click on the title of a show, it starts streaming immediately when I just want to go and pick an episode to play. The play button and the title should have different functions.
Title: Can‚Äôt see the difference

Content: The app in it‚Äôs current state is buggy and has idiosyncrasies that HBO didn‚Äôt have. Like not only adding previews for other shows to the movie you‚Äôre watching but adding it to the timeline so that if you go to the beginning it starts the preview over.  However, the worse thing for me coming from HBO is the archaic practice of charging extra for 4K and HDR. The bandwidth costs to stream 4k over HD are negligible, making this a blatant money grab that keeps watching content the way creators intended out of reach for many viewers at $20/month. Ironically, 4k HDR is the one of the only advantages first party apps have over the numerous pirate sites out there, so by removing 4k HDR from standard plans they essentially remove one of the top reasons to pay vs pirate. I personally am willing to limit myself to services (like disney+ and apple tv) that don‚Äôt charge extra for 4K solely for principle. HBO had a loyal customer in me. Max, not so much.
Title: Worse than HBO Max

Content: I‚Äôm so annoyed. First off, the name change is dumb. I subscribed to HBO because of the power of the HBO brand. It‚Äôs synonymous with good, quality television. Rebranding to get rid of HBO makes it seem like you want to get rid of me as a customer.  As far as the app goes, there‚Äôs no reason you couldn‚Äôt just have renamed the existing app. Instead, making us all jump through a million hoops to download an entirely new app, for literally NO benefit to us as customers, is ridiculous and anti-consumer.   Finally, basic functionality is (still) missing, even from this new app. Every video app on every platform for literally decades now has had the same basic convention: you press the spacebar to pause or resume a video. This app doesn‚Äôt do that. As far as I can tell, there are no keyboard shortcuts to interact with the app at all. Given many, many people use their iPads attached to a Smart Keyboard (or any bluetooth keyboard), this is a baffling oversight that would be SO easy to fix if the company cared about making their app easy to use. (Is this a small thing? Of course, as much as I want to be able to tap the spacebar once to pause it instead of having to tap the screen twice. But it‚Äôs indicative of the complete lack of care being put into this.)  I don‚Äôt know why I should keep paying money for a service that seems to have no interest in putting its customers first.
Title: Anti-customer nonsense

Content: While HBO Max or newly minted ‚ÄúMAX‚Äù is one of my favorite streaming services, this app is horrendous! From the constant crashes, casting hiccups, and interface issues, this app needs serious help. Granted this version of the app is ‚Äúnew‚Äù, it seems more like a copy and paste from the old HBO Max app with a slight redesign. This app carries over many of the flaws that the old app had that I assumed would‚Äôve been corrected with the launch of this one. When casting to a device, the option to pause or add subtitles doesn‚Äôt work. In addition there is no back or forward tracking option. Hopefully these issues will be corrected fairly soon. I love the content on this app although it makes it almost impossible to watch in its current condition. I hope the developers are able to correct the problems and continue to make improvements for the future. Thank you for your hard work!
Title: Please fix app UI !!
