Content: You know the radio hasn‚Äôt heard a not for miles right.   The hosts are at home asleep   But with your numb clamming fingers stuck to that steering wheel, you don‚Äôt care.  You‚Äôre too focused on getting out.   It's hard to believe it‚Äôs been 3 hours since you‚Äôve seen them  You miss them, but that doesn‚Äôt seem to bother you  All that matters is getting there, seeing them.   Then maybe you‚Äôll feel it again  A click, a sound on the radio, a sign of life.   You recognize the song but can‚Äôt remember the words.   A melody, flows in the shape of sadness, and the feeling of cold.   It reminds you of something  A thought that cost you a freethought for the rest of your life.  You waited for this moment  It came, and it went, and you feel exactly the same way you‚Äôve felt for 3 days  And now you‚Äôre left with my thoughts again.   The memory doesn‚Äôt fade  You can feel their skin  It was awfully dark to tell, wasn‚Äôt it  That‚Äôs the last time you felt it.  What a way to start your adult life.  Lose at your own hands is a uniquely terrible thing.  But when it‚Äôs past, it‚Äôs past   You have to move on.   After all its been 3 weeks and you‚Äôre still gripping that steering wheel   Nomatter how numb your fingers are.  When they left, you felt nothing.  And when they came back, you felt worse.  That‚Äôs why you did it  You waited for this  You weren‚Äôt sure it was the right time, but.  You had to do it.  You loved her  I have nothing to do with this  I have nothing in common with you, nor do I wish to.   I am merely the messenger of your intrusive thoughts.  The executioner of rash decisions  Thats me, in your head  I offer to all, but you accepted.  You acted on it.  And you don't know when you‚Äôll be able to see it.  3 months, wanting a way out of the situation  Out of your mind   That‚Äôs why you took a drive.   Static, because you‚Äôve been driving for 3 years now,  And your glassy eyes can‚Äôt see your knuckles have gone white  And your ringing ears can‚Äôt hear me anymore.   The radio has been static for a while now, but  You‚Äôre still humming that tune you heard 3 days ago  They were there with you  You‚Äôre dry lips crack and bleed when you smile.  You can feel them now  Sweet static clawing at your cheeks  But your dry eyes, and your cracked lips can barely feel the tears falling  A sunrise on a new day, a cloud atop a hill  You can see it   In your rear view mirror  A mirage of a better decision  Would you believe it if you saw it?  Would you want to?  You know what you did.  But refuse to accept it  A world that gave them to you  And took them away  It doesn‚Äôt matter   They will move on.  They will forgive you   But you took the air for them to say that   Great things come for those who wait  For the static, the fog, the ringing to stop  After all without the rain, the flowers still come  You‚Äôre 3 minutes away now   And you can finally open your eyes  But adventures never really end do they?  Someone has to carry on the story.
Title: My story

Content: I recently had the pleasure of exploring the streaming service Max, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in many ways. With its vast library of movies and TV shows, Max truly offers a delightful entertainment experience. The user interface is intuitive and easy to navigate, allowing me to effortlessly discover new content and enjoy my favorite shows.  One aspect that particularly impressed me was the quality of the streaming. The video and audio were both crystal clear, ensuring an immersive viewing experience. Furthermore, Max's recommendation algorithm seemed to understand my preferences well, suggesting a variety of titles that matched my interests perfectly.  Additionally, Max offers a great selection of original content. From gripping dramas to hilarious comedies, there's something for everyone. I found myself binge-watching several of their original series, thoroughly enjoying the captivating storytelling and brilliant performances.  While the recent name change to Max may have caught some users off guard, I believe it is a testament to the company's commitment to rebranding and adapting to the evolving market. After all, a name doesn't define the quality of the service it represents. Max remains a top-notch streaming platform, and I look forward to continued enjoyment of its exceptional content.  Mean Review: Let me start by saying that the recent name change to Max for this streaming service was absolutely dumb. Seriously, who came up with that? It's like they just picked a random three-letter word out of a hat and decided to roll with it. It's neither catchy nor memorable, and it certainly doesn't reflect the excitement and innovation one would expect from a streaming platform.  But let's move past the name and focus on the service itself. Frankly, I found Max to be rather underwhelming. The library of content is limited compared to other streaming platforms, and the user interface feels clunky and outdated. It's a struggle to find anything worth watching, and the recommendation algorithm seems to be completely off the mark.  Even worse, the streaming quality is often subpar, with frequent buffering and poor video resolution. It's frustrating to invest time and money into a service only to have it constantly interrupted by technical issues. It's as if Max doesn't prioritize providing a smooth and seamless viewing experience for its users.  To add insult to injury, the original content on Max is mostly lackluster. The shows and movies I encountered were uninteresting and failed to captivate my attention. It's a shame because other streaming platforms have raised the bar with their compelling originals, but Max seems to fall flat in this regard.  In conclusion, the name change to Max was just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the disappointments I experienced with this streaming service. With its limited content, poor user interface, and lackluster original productions, Max leaves much to be desired. Save your money and look elsewhere for a more satisfying streaming experience.

Content: If you're on the lookout for a streaming app that delivers an unparalleled entertainment experience, look no further than Max, the sensational HBO app. Max has completely revolutionized the way we enjoy movies and shows, offering an outstanding range of content combined with a user-friendly interface that will leave you in awe.  From the moment you open the app, Max grabs your attention with its sleek design and intuitive layout. Browsing through the extensive library of movies and shows is an absolute pleasure, thanks to its well-organized categories and powerful search functionality. Whether you're in the mood for an action-packed thriller, a heartwarming drama, a thought-provoking documentary, or anything in between, Max has you covered with its diverse and captivating selection.  What truly sets Max apart is its unrivaled collection of HBO originals and exclusive content. The app seamlessly delivers the latest releases from HBO, providing subscribers with access to critically acclaimed series like "Game of Thrones," "Chernobyl," "Westworld," and "Succession." These shows have redefined television and become cultural phenomena, and Max grants you unlimited access to binge-watch them to your heart's content.  But Max doesn't stop there. The app also offers a treasure trove of movies from various genres, ensuring there's something for everyone. From timeless classics to the latest blockbusters, you can dive into a world of cinematic wonders. With Max, you're not just subscribing to a streaming service; you're gaining entry to a boundless universe of storytelling that will captivate and enthrall you.  The streaming quality on Max is exceptional, delivering stunning visuals and crisp audio that enhances your viewing experience. Whether you're streaming on your TV, laptop, or mobile device, Max optimizes the content for each platform, ensuring that you're immersed in every frame. The app also provides the option to download movies and episodes for offline viewing, perfect for those long flights or when you're on the go.  One of Max's standout features is its personalized recommendations. Through its intelligent algorithms, the app learns your viewing preferences and suggests movies and shows tailored to your tastes. This thoughtful curation allows you to discover hidden gems and explore new genres, making every session on Max a delightful journey of exploration.  In addition to its outstanding content and user-friendly interface, Max offers exceptional customer service and support. The app is regularly updated with new features and improvements, and any technical issues are promptly addressed, ensuring a seamless and hassle-free streaming experience.  Max's subscription plans are competitively priced, offering excellent value for the sheer quantity and quality of content available. With a range of options to choose from, including family plans, Max accommodates different viewing needs and budgets, making it accessible to a wide audience.

Content: The library of content is wide and generally interesting, although it seems to have overloaded on chintzy reality trash lately, at the expense of HBO‚Äôs library and other top-tier titles. What is especially concerning is that the really good drama and comedy series are fewer and further between in recent years. Apple TV+ has taken the mantle for ‚Äòpremium TV where every show is worth a watch‚Äô away from HBO, which seems to be increasingly inert.  The video player is fine, but there‚Äôs nothing in the non-native interface that justifies itself over the native player. Subtitles sometimes get activated without consent, especially when a video gets windowboxed to suggest a next title, but one returns to the current video for watching the end credits. Circular scrubbing with the Apple TV remote is missing. I also can‚Äôt tap (not click) the remote to dismiss the video player controls or see the current end-time of the video. All of these are annoying. Very annoying. Netflix uses the native player and it‚Äôs great. This is worse. I don‚Äôt understand why HBO/Max doesn‚Äôt use the native player, although I‚Äôm sure some middle manager is enjoying a bonus somehow.  Being able to skip pre-roll content ads as a no-ads customer is a table stakes feature at this point and one of the things I appreciate when compared to Paramount+, which forces viewing of such ads even for premium/‚Äúno ads‚Äù subscribers. Don‚Äôt ever change that.  If I could change three things, one would be to revert to the native video player as explained above. Second would be to lose the overlay showing rating/content info at the beginning of any title for far too long as playback starts. Either return to an info card as one might see on an HBO broadcast in the past 35+ years, or find some other way to not have it in the way of whatever show or movie has already started.  Last would be to re-enable the download/use of the iPad app for Mac users (or make a native Mac app). While streaming in the browser is ‚Äòfine‚Äô, not being able to download titles for offline viewing is seriously shortsighted. Prime Video has an app for Mac users, and downloads are available. Apple TV+ (and any subscriptions via the TV app) does too. The old HBO Max app was enabled and worked great on my Macs. My M2 MacBook Air is my best portable screen and I dislike the notion of ‚Äòtaking a iPad too‚Äô just to have this flexibility. I see no reason not to opt-in to Mac use of the app that isn‚Äôt traceable to a paranoid, distrustful stance towards paying customers.  It‚Äôs an above average service, a okay app with seemingly easily-fixable shortcomings, and there‚Äôs nothing I need to go back and forth with customer support about. Fix the deficiencies and this becomes an unqualified top-tier 5-star option.

Content: Go to a site like Metacritic and search on HBO and Max. Unless you want a few reality shows from the Discovery side, there is basically nothing being offered from HBO or Max over the next 6 months. What a drop from the stellar premiere service of old. After selling content to other services, the new CEO wants to make money by only producing cheap content. Sure there are still some old hits hanging out for those who have never seen them, and some decent series were wrapped up, but for the monthly price Max is asking there are MUCh better options. Apple TV has been killing it with new content and Netflix has something for everyone. Even Peacock and Paramount have managed to offer some interesting stuff. Max is not a must have anymore. Get it for a month or two and then move on. It's time to send a message to services who intentionally holdback on new content and ask equivalent payment to those who continue to add new programming to theirs. And to be clear, this is not because of the writers strike which will ultimately affect all services. This was planned and advertised well in advance of that. I have no problem paying a service like Netflix who offers a variety of content even if not all of it appeals to me. Vote with your pocketbooks people or they will continue to take advantage of a brand name that they no longer support or honor. ================================================== UPDATEüòÉ: A feature I did not find until today ups this App's functionality and I wish all other Apps would do this. No matter where you are in the App, by holding down the Select button on a show/movie you would like put in your List, it will automatically put it there. You can also delete in the same manner. Similarly you can also delete content in your Continue Watching area by holding down the Select button. I have tested this on Apple TV plus a Fire Cube and both work although on Fire Cube you must hold down the Select button longer plus to remove you hold down longer than get asked if you want to delete. I can't give this App any more stars until content is more defined in the GUI interface but the above usability is a stellar improvement. ******************************************************************** Seldom does a new app come out without glaring bugs. So far this one seems to be the exception. Voice search on Apple TV and control over Autoplay are welcome features. However, with the addition of Discovery Plus content the app has become overwhelming in size. The category 'Brand Spotlight' is buried several rows down, as other Apps have done, where placing it on the top would be more efficient and practical. The massive amount of categories and large picture icons is time consuming to navigate and only serves to keep eyes in the app rather than help direct consumers to content they would prefer. Unfortunately, MAX has not broken away from all the other apps that have crowded screens that need to be endlessly scrolled to find something to watch. The categories 'For You' and ‚ÄòFeatured' are more about them trying to steer you to programming they want you to watch. Taking away sidebars in the Home Screen that helped you quickly narrow your search was a huge mistake. The top row of Home, Series, Movies, HBO, New & Notable is so generic that, with the amount of content MAX now has, it just opens up a maze that is cavernous. At some point content providers will have to come to the realization that customers respond better to simplicity than complexity. At first the 'All you can eat' buffet of programming does dazzle consumers but eventually that wears off and they become weary of the struggle to find a good content fit.

Content: HBOmax had a user friendly interface that compiled all the shows into categories that made them easy to find and gave good recommendations based on the content you were in. Now max does this worthless amalgamation of all of its content so you NEVER MISS A SHOW OR MOVIE. It‚Äôs irritating and it makes me want to leave the app more than watch a show. Before I could go to the sub categories and find exactly what I was looking for, or find new content that I wasn‚Äôt even aware of prior to starting up the app and looking at the home page. Now I‚Äôm bombarded with endless shows and movies that I have zero intention of watching and when I do find something that interests me even remotely the lack of any follow up material is beyond lack luster. Where you expecting content related to you current watch? Not here at MAX, we just shove all of our high budget shows and movies right back into your face! I literally watched the newest Shazam and when the movie finished I was hoping to continue on the DC train and instead I got; some terrible show that doesn‚Äôt interest me, the Meg, a documentary, and another show. Thanks max.  Adult Swims hub was great for watching a lot of shows I grew up on or just enjoy and instead that‚Äôs gone. Have to search for my shows like truffle pig hoping just to find one. Before I‚Äôd watch multiple shows because they were all conveniently placed for that specific reason and now I forget half of what I‚Äôm looking for because of the constant need for max to validate it‚Äôs terrible box office performances.  Just fix this already.

Content: I have been paying for the ad free option of HBO Max for several years now, essentially since the app launched. I‚Äôve used it nearly every day since then. It‚Äôs always been my number one streaming service. Now I‚Äôm seriously considering cancelling all together. I‚Äôve just taken a look at this new app and I‚Äôm really shocked. This is such a downgrade in quality. To the point that I feel like paying for it is a waste of my money. When Max was announced I assumed it would just mean a rebranding of the app I already used. Just a new name and maybe some more hubs added for additional content. I don‚Äôt understand the thought process behind creating a whole new app when the previous one was fine.   What irks me the most is the design and confusing layout. One of the main reasons I stopped using Netflix was due to their terrible layout. Even though Netflix has a lot of content I find it hard to ever find anything to watch because navigating their selection is so difficult. The navigation on HBO max was always LEAPS ahead of any other service. I found navigating it very easy to do. However all of the features that I enjoyed on the previous app are just gone now. And Max looks a lot like Netflix now. I really don‚Äôt now how I‚Äôm going to use this. Unless there is a massive overhaul in design change and navigation soon, I will cancel my subscription. I‚Äôd rather risk a virus and pirate the films and tv I want to watch than pay for a service that I won‚Äôt and can‚Äôt use. Really really disappointed today.
Title: Considering cancelling

Content: I recently subscribed to the "Max" streaming service, and I must say, it has been a pleasant surprise. While it may not be perfect, Max offers a solid streaming experience that is worth considering for any avid movie and TV show enthusiast.  One of the standout features of Max is its extensive library of content. With a vast collection of movies and TV shows from various genres, there is something for everyone. Whether you're into action, romance, comedy, or documentaries, Max has you covered. The platform also boasts a good mix of both popular and lesser-known titles, allowing users to discover hidden gems they might have otherwise missed.  The user interface of Max is clean, intuitive, and easy to navigate. Browsing through the library is a breeze, thanks to well-organized categories and a robust search function. The platform also provides personalized recommendations based on your viewing history, which helps in discovering new content tailored to your preferences.  One aspect that sets Max apart from other streaming services is its emphasis on curated collections and exclusive content. The "Max Originals" section offers a range of high-quality, original productions that are both entertaining and thought-provoking. These exclusive shows and movies add value to the service and make it stand out from the competition.  Another notable feature of Max is its streaming quality. The service offers a reliable and stable streaming experience, with minimal buffering, high-definition, and 4K playback. The video and audio quality are impressive, ensuring an immersive viewing experience.  However, there are a few areas where Max could improve. While the library is extensive, there are still some notable titles missing, which can be disappointing for those looking for specific content. Additionally, the availability of subtitles and language options could be expanded to cater to a more diverse audience.  Overall, Max is a solid streaming service that offers a wide range of content, a user-friendly interface, and excellent streaming quality. With its curated collections and exclusive originals, it manages to stand out in a crowded market. While there is room for improvement, Max is definitely worth considering for anyone seeking a diverse and enjoyable streaming experience.
Title: A Solid Streaming Experience with Max

Content: It‚Äôs been a few weeks into my subscription , at this point I refuse to change subscriptions to another service because I do catch random programming I enjoy ‚Ä¶but I got the low tier with commercials , I don‚Äôt mind the commercials but the app will cast and play movies at full volume and in Spanish or worse yet Descriptive Audio Spanish , so it‚Äôs like I just stole from a bodega and the owner is yelling at me when I try to watch a movie at first ‚Ä¶I can fiddle with the settings some to get around the oddity , but the setting to turn the descriptive audio off is removed from the UI ‚Ä¶which is also part of the glitch or problem . Whatever it is , it‚Äôs almost comedically engineered to frustrate . Customer service is non existent . I‚Äôd been contacted once ..my first contact I was given the equivalent of a screen shot from a trouble shooting faq they‚Äôd developed . So they did not read my email . The second time they reached out was a customer service form they sent me ‚Ä¶because apparently reading my complaint on the app on the App Store or reading my email prior wasn‚Äôt possible . It‚Äôs annoying and utterly the reason I‚Äôll end my subscription . I‚Äôd requested a refund and that‚Äôs just not a thing with them . Considering I believe the glitch to be by design . I mean come on , the button to set the language and descriptive audio back was removed , I think the design maybe intentional somewhere ‚Ä¶it‚Äôs seems logical because of the parallel of how it‚Äôs made to give no solution besides playing with the connections and different app and tv combos . Not sure , I‚Äôm convinced that a lot of the tech companies mess with each others business . Either way makes the app the worst and I‚Äôd stay away personally , if it works for you , then the programming isn‚Äôt half bad . Best of luck

Content: HBO Max changing to MAX seems like another pointless rebranding.   Sure, if you look up the differences between the two, I‚Äôm sure the list would be fairly long, but there are still the same issues HBO Max had.   The only noticeable thing, and this could change, is the app lags less when it launches. While the design was slightly changed, there still isn‚Äôt a way to clear a show or movie you started and don‚Äôt intend to finish.   There are still issues where an episode that was watched previously, starts again at the end, when ‚Äúnext episode‚Äù was clicked. Then you have to navigate back to that episode‚Äôs home screen, (which is different from the show‚Äôs Home Screen, which is different from the regular Home Screen) and hit the ‚Äúrestart episode‚Äù button.   When you click on an episode, it immediately plays, rather than showing the episode‚Äôs Home Screen, where you can continue where you left off, or restart the show/movie. So there‚Äôs a lot of clicking and then backing up, just to do one thing.   Plus the new ‚Äúshows like this‚Äù button, always gets it the way when trying to navigate to a specific season. They put that in a bad place. Selecting a season should be easier than choosing a different show entirely.  The functionality and navigation is still quite flawed. It looks a little better, but while appearance is nice, I think the priority should have been fixing the navigation issues.   So while I like the app‚Äôs show and movie selection, the lack of ease with navigating the app leave a lot to be desired.   I‚Äôd rather be able to use it easier, than have it only look slightly better than it did.
Title: Unnecessary update that leaves flaws intact

Content: As an avid HBO Max user, I was intrigued when I heard about the new Max app. Having used it for a while now, I have mixed feelings about it. Let me share my thoughts on the app from a first-person perspective.  One thing that caught my attention right away is the improved loading speed. The new Max app definitely delivers on that front. It's refreshing to see how quickly the content loads, allowing me to dive into my favorite shows and movies without any delay. Kudos to the developers for this improvement.  However, there are a few aspects of the app that left me slightly disappointed. One of the features I enjoyed in the previous HBO Max interface was the easy access to genres through the sidebar. It made it convenient for me to explore different categories and discover new content. Unfortunately, the Max app makes this process more cumbersome, requiring excessive swiping and searching to find a specific company or genre. This change felt like a step backward in terms of user-friendliness.  Another drawback I noticed is the absence of a feature to delete a family profile. This omission puzzled me, as it seems like a basic functionality that should be present in a streaming app. It can be frustrating not being able to manage profiles effectively, especially in a family setting.  Despite these downsides, the Max app still retains the overall look and feel of HBO Max, which is reassuring. The familiar interface and content library provide a sense of continuity. However, when considering the drawbacks and inconveniences I mentioned earlier, I don't find the new app compelling enough to warrant uninstalling the old one and installing the updated version.  In conclusion, my experience with the new Max app has been a mixed bag. While the faster loading speed is a definite plus, the hassle of finding specific companies or genres and the absence of a profile deletion feature are notable downsides. If you're an HBO Max user, I'd suggest giving the new app a try, but unless these issues are addressed, it may not be worth the trouble of switching from the previous version.
Title: A mixed bag

Content: First off, the whole thing feels a little more stable which is nice, so GOOD work there.  Simply a better set of options for organizing and viewing your own list would be welcomed.  What is NOT great is that the point in time that you are at in a particular video doesn‚Äôt show. Other streaming apps either show it to left of the progress bar or on the actual point at which you are. It would be a much nicer experience.  Another gripe about the progress/time scrub bar is that the arrow forward/back buttons on remotes no longer nudge forward or backward in 10 second increments. Instead it engages fast forward at a speed that is way too fast to quickly stop. It is very frustrating, and brings me to my final issue‚Ä¶  The fast forward/rewind speeds of the actual forward/backward buttons need be addressed in that there needs to be a much slower first-press speed, and a much faster last press speed; I mean slow-mo to fast enough to get to the midway point of a 3 hr movie within a few seconds and completely fast forward through the entire thing in under 10 seconds. It would be extremely welcome for us.  Lastly, as a lover of all things Discovery (especially ID), BRAVO on the new integration. It is a big task and I‚Äôm sure will only improve with time. We absolutely love all of the options available. Now just give a new show or movie a chance to gel before unceremoniously ripping it from the service - in some cases with forever cliffhangers - and you are the best thing available to consumers by a mile!  Sincerely and with the utmost respect, A humble, lifelong lover of HBO and Discovery

Content: The message was that the hbo max app was going to  automatically become the max app. So far I have had to download a new app and delete the old one on my iPhone and Samsung tv. Thankfully my login still worked, although I guess they wouldn‚Äôt delete my payment info because that‚Äôs what they really want.   I really liked the set up to HBO Max, specifically the list based off studio or whatever they titled the list of DC universe, HBO originals, Cartoon Network, Studio Ghibli and the other ones, I also loved the list of genres those lists allowed me to say I want something I haven‚Äôt seen before that is like this other movie or show I watch.   Max only has 3 menu options; Home, Search and My Stuff which makes it a lot harder to browse or find something if you don‚Äôt know the name of it.   I was excited for Discovery + to become part of HBO Max because there were documentaries I wanted to see on there but don‚Äôt remember the names and it‚Äôs hard to find them seeing as there is no Discovery list. All the emails I received said that Discovery + was becoming part of HBO Max and it was being called Max and you wouldn‚Äôt loose anything. Well I lost the browsing ease I had before.   All they had to do was add what was available on Discovery + to HBO Max and change the name to Max and yet they went with the deactivate the old apps and delete the entire menu that organized things so nicely and made it easier to find something new to watch in the same style as what you enjoyed before. I don‚Äôt like the ‚Äúyou might also enjoy list, because it not accurate and it‚Äôs marketing off what they can make money off of. I personally hate the show Rick and Morty, and yet it shows up on multiple ‚Äúyou might also like‚Äù lists for me. How is Rick and Morty in anyway related to live action DC universe works? I think it‚Äôs more about the Rick and Morty merchandise they have for sale.   Bring back the menu lists of genres and groupings by studio or channel or universe or however they did it, because that is what I liked the most about HBO Max.

Content: Interface is terrible on Apple TV.  Rewind and fast forward will bug out and force you to hit the back button to get out of the interface. This then undoes the time change and puts you back where you started.  Sometimes the back buttons does nothing and you have to close the app. Garbage.    Want to rewatch a watched episode?  Find it and hit play. You will see the last 3 seconds of that episodes closing credits just before it skips to the next episode. What? Every streaming app out there would have just restarted this episode from the beginning as expected. Not the new MAX!  Want a description of the episode? No longer available when you highlight a thumbnail. You now have click into a few sub menus to find and read the description. This is also where you need to go to find the now hidden ‚Äúrestart‚Äù option for an already watched episode.    Had a few episodes play while you were away or fell asleep? Want to rewatch them? Click on the show conveniently under ‚ÄúContinue Watching‚Äù and‚Ä¶. it instantly continues playing where it left off. No interface for the season or show at all. You literally have go to the main screen, ‚ÄúSearch‚Äù, type in the name of the show, click on the show, select the season, then GUESS which thumbnail you want because the episode descriptions are buried under the ‚ÄúEpisode Details‚Äù button.  Ugh.   Every other streaming app is more intuitive than this crap. And have been for YEARS. The old HBO Max was fine. This new MAX is complete garbage on the Apple TV.  It‚Äôs like the Apple TV app was designed by an intern or diversity hire that has zero to little experience.  Do better, Warner Bros!
Title: Terrible on Apple TV

Content: Truly this is a fall from grace. HBO Max was my favorite steaming service of which I have used. Now I hate it. Ignoring all of the blatant downgrades, and tangibly terrible features, my biggest problem is the download limit.   It is useless and, from what I can tell, serves no purpose other than to force people to buy the more expensive version, which is an even worse deal in my opinion. Essentially you can only download 30 episodes or movies at any given time on the middlemost expensive option. That sounds pretty bad, but considering that most other streaming services allow you to have an unlimited amount, it‚Äôs very terrible. Really, 30 items? Reallllly? Think of it, most shows have about 12 episodes per season. You have even download 3 seasons of a single show! And it serves them no purpose other than to make money.   Think of it, why would they not want you to download more shows, instead of an unlimited amount of shows as it used to be on HBO max? It couldn‚Äôt be anything to do with data, and it‚Äôs not running of a server when I watching it off of what I downloaded on my phone. Money! It always comes back to that. They went form paying whatever it was per month, for an observably great service, to a terrible service, with to option to pay more for a slightly less terrible service, to a service that isn‚Äôt even worth considering, considering that 4 extra dollars isn‚Äôt worth it.  The UI has also had a considerable downgrade too. I won‚Äôt go into much detail in this part, but things being sorted alphabetically, and more stuff like they were very convenient. And that‚Äôs the sole purpose of a user interface, is convenience, not to spend minutes looking to find something to watch when it should take seconds at most.   Albeit, I still cannot deny the library. It‚Äôs still probably the best. Shows and movies that everyone likes; classics, new movies, shows and more, were, and are still there. But what‚Äôs the point if I can hardly download much of them, or it‚Äôs tedious just to find them. If you look to TV channels, what do you do? You go to the guide and scroll down the channels. Very simple, but a thousand times more easy then the milquetoast UI of Max now. They tried to copy Netflix, and failed terribly. They have the categories like Netflix, but you can only see two cards instead of many more as it should be. So you have to scroll to the side very slowly, and you can only see two or three of the categories at a time, and that‚Äôs just one example. Imagine spending hours using the UI and picking it apart then and all the flaws you could find within it.  Again, this is a call for grace. HBO Max was almost undoubtedly the best. The three main things it had going for it were a good library, a good UI, and generally not being frustrating, with glitches and all that. From what I can tell it has only kept one of those. And that is a loss, considering that some of my favorite shows are on there. Essentially, HBO Max was great, Max is bad, fix it please.

Content: The Max app represents a *horrible* regression from the already supremely crappy HBO Max app. The UI is cluttered; the lack of sufficient margins around buttons makes them look and feel claustrophobic; navigation around the UI doesn‚Äôt support the native ‚Äúleaning‚Äù paradigm, so movement from element to element is sudden, jarring, often unexpected and unintended, and can even happen *after* clicking a button to navigate to a submenu or play a video (admittedly, this is a holdover from the HBO Max app); the player itself, which is a custom implementation (alas, an all too common trend), doesn‚Äôt even support basic Apple TV functions like using the remote ring as a jog wheel for slow scrubbing; and perhaps the biggest regression‚Äîthe app no longer integrates with the Up Next list in the Apple TV app. This is almost certainly a cross-platform atrocity that Warner Bros. Discovery is trying to pass off as platform-native app‚Äîand it shows. It‚Äôs also clearly just an (inferior) re-skinning of the bug-ridden HBO Max app, despite HBO executives‚Äô insistence that the app would be ‚Äúrewritten from the ground up.‚Äù (And to top it all off, once you stream something from within the Max app, Warner Bros. Discovery appears to bar your account from accessing the ‚Äúclassic‚Äù HBO Max app, precluding the ability to revert to that slightly less terrible older app‚Äîwith no advance warning whatsoever.)  And this is all in addition to the continued foolhardy adulteration of HBO‚Äôs peerless array of first-class content with lowest-common-denominator tripe from the company‚Äôs Discovery and network TV libraries. Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs behavior betrays a fundamental lack of respect for its viewers and represents a continued squandering of the formerly nonpareil brand equity that HBO had spent nigh fifty years painstakingly accruing. David Zaslav should be ashamed.
Title: Horrible Regression & Continued Erosion of the HBO Brand

Content: Don't really see why we needed to download a new app when they could've just updated the old one and make the changes they needed to do with that like every other streaming platform does?!?  Also really annoyed they are limiting screens to watch at the same time like Netflix is did with how many screens you want to pay for. A lot of people dropped Netflix in favor of MAX, so they continue down the same route of Netflix, they will lose a lot of people eventually as well, especially with the high price we are already paying for HBO.  Issues with new app is annoying. I have Apple TV and the newer model remote, I will be scrolling with the touch pad and after about 10-15 options (or less sometimes) it's takes me back to the very top of the page making me having to go all the way back down to the row where I was searching, thankfully it doesn't start me from the very beginning of that row with having to scroll to where I last was, but having a glitch every time I scroll from side to side is not a fun thing to deal with. I tested it with using the buttons on the remote instead of the touch pad and same thing! So I know it's not an apple thing and an app thing!  My advice to MAX, don't go the Netflix route and if it's not broke stop trying to fix it. Small improvements with updates are welcomed, but a whole new app for us to download was a bit ridiculous! Also stop raising prices! You guys don't enough original or new content to justify going higher in price then you currently are!

Content: I‚Äôve been updating my review since May 2023 since the app changed. Now, I can‚Äôt update it anymore. It‚Äôs gone. It‚Äôs frustrating bc it was extensive‚Äî but fret not! I remember all my complaints :) here they are, enjoy:  September 2023 -I start my show, and it turns up as green. The contrast is completely messed up.  I have to go back to Home and restart it  -Also, when I pause and then unpause, it starts back up somewhere completely different.  -Also, I don‚Äôt see an option to remove shows from my History so that I can rewatch them‚Äîonce it‚Äôs watched, and I want to rewatch it, I click an episode, and it goes to the very end of the episode which is where I stopped the last time I was watching. It‚Äôs a mess.  -Moreover, sometimes I start playing an episode and the screen doesn‚Äôt fit in my TV, it‚Äôs literally 4x the size of what it should be. - It also does this thing that if I click on my show from Continue Watching, it sometimes goes to blank black screen & plays audio from a different movie / show.  Previously, between May-August 2023, the app didn‚Äôt show the ‚ÄúContinue Watching‚Äù section properly (they fixed that).   They also had an issue where I had English CC turned on but it wouldn‚Äôt show up. The only way to make it show up would be going to Subtitles, choosing a different language CC, then choosing English CC again. And still, sometimes it wouldn‚Äôt show up. (This has been since fixed).  If I remember something I will for sure add. I am 99% sure most 5 star reviews must be paid, there‚Äôs no way so many people are happy, just read the other 1star reviews. Too. Many. Issues.   HBO messed up big time switching to this ‚ÄúMAX‚Äù app. Why fix something that wasn‚Äôt broken? Why did you get such a terrible team of incompetent app creators? I‚Äôve never had that many issues with an app.
Title: Worst. App. In. the. history. Of. Mankind.

Content: Time Warner has managed to ruin all of the things that were good (or at least decent) about the experience from the HBO Max app on tvOS.  For starters, this should not have required a new app install, it should have just updated the old one in place given their plans to shut off access to the old app. Bad planning to foist that pain onto users for no good reason.  Now, getting to the actual app. It was a big controversy when HBO Max switched from the native tvOS player to its own custom inferior player, so they promptly reverted the change. So what does the new Max app do? Implement a far inferior custom player that doesn‚Äôt work with most of the basic built-in functions of the tvOS player or feel like an app designed for the platform. I would choose stronger words to analogize this but given it‚Äôs an App Store review, I‚Äôll just say it‚Äôs downright insulting and user-hostile.  On top of that, for the first hour after I installed the app I couldn‚Äôt even get it to sign in and was getting server side errors when trying to view the ‚Äúsign in with provider‚Äù page. Ugly black & white unbranded error pages full of technical jargon which should never be shown to users to begin with. This is how they decided to ship this broken, subpar app. I gave up and was fortunately able to sign in the following morning.  Fix your terrible app. If you‚Äôre going to build a custom player, it had better be incredibly good and come with all of the standard functionality of the built-in player. But since it‚Äôs clear your software team doesn‚Äôt have the capability of doing that, please just switch back to the built-in tvOS player. You will not do a better job designing a usable playback experience than what Apple has given you (basically nobody else does).
Title: Ruined everything that was good about HBO Max on tvOS

Content: My app is acting up and I can‚Äôt read or see half of the screen. They sent me an email saying beginning December 5. It will stream only be in an HD and no longer and 4K no longer in Dolby Atmos. Will only allow me to sign in on two devices. everything has lowered and quality about this app. Funny they tell me this while the apps not functioning. FYI, I pay for a premium no add package and they started showing advertisements for media. They produced by Max ahead of my shows still finding a way to play ads even though I pay for no ad service. Cheesy. Actually, I am mostly finding great entertainment from my Hulu app. More and more Max is forcing changes and lowering the quality and usually doesn‚Äôt have anything that I want so if my review helps somebody to make a decision, then don‚Äôt buy in to Max. Look at all of your other choices, especially Hulu. Disney is available on Hulu I love my Disney+ app. I‚Äôm just trying to get the word out there. They‚Äôre doing this really slick right after taking over and making all these changes matter of fact that are nothing better for the customer.  I responded to the Max support that answered this review and filled out the request form and gave them permission to email me and to use my email. Now this morning that person sends me an email and said somebody else on our advanced team is looking at this and they will let you know if they have any questions or updates. But this person named Ronnie didn‚Äôt offer to help me at all but they made me think oh they care. I‚Äôm gonna respond but they didn‚Äôt do anything and now I got to feel like something would happen but it didn‚Äôt extra disappointing.
Title: Max has lowered the quality.

So I subscribed to Max, not expecting much, oh boy was I wrong‚Ä¶ not only do they have all the new movies but they have oldies but goodies that I have not seen in years. Content: I began tuning into NBA games on Max when they offered a complimentary sports package until February 2024. Given my preference for TNT broadcasts and the free access, it seemed like a great alternative to paying for YouTube TV.  However, my experience with watching sports on Max has been frustrating because it doesn't save my progress. It's frustrating to start from the beginning and manually navigate the progress bar to find where I left off.  Personally, I'm considering reactivating my YouTube TV subscription and discontinuing my Max membership. I would advise others planning to watch sports on Max to do the same.  It's definitely not providing a satisfactory user experience!
Title: Watching sports on this platform isn‚Äôt ideal.

Content: On Roku, crashes, lags and freezes constantly. 10 sec rew button use to do exactly that but now just acts as 2nd rew button. Every week or so won‚Äôt let you connect at all if you‚Äôre subscribing through a cable provider, no matter what you do, says either your cable plan doesn‚Äôt have max and/or you have to create an account (account wasnt necessary in the previous app) again. This last time had to create a new account with new email and all my lists and settings vanished lol. Newest bug (10/29/23) is that in the middle of watching an eppy it goes to a black screen and there‚Äôs nothing you can do to fix it, although other eppys of same series are fine to watch.  Literally a new bug every week, I kid you not‚Ä¶  Features vanished such as the ‚ÄúHub‚Äù where you could go to DC and find that Batman movies without much searching. Now, you actually have to type it in lol. Or the Last Chance where you can see what‚Äôs leaving. Other features like Subtitles (which I use all the time) didn‚Äôt work at first but now do, hopefully. No other apps on iOS or Roku have any of these issues. None‚Ä¶.  Their first rollout of the Max app was arguably the worst functional, streaming app ever, both on iOS and Roku, I thought at the time (now this one beats it). They eventually improved it to where it was decent. So sick of the changes with every new app. Have it as part of a mandatory cable subscription package in my co-op and would cancel in a sec if not for that
Title: Absolute s-show of an app now

Content: The app is just a dumping ground for content with no efficient way to navigate. Content suggestion leaves a lot to be desired.
Title: Is this app Max or Just a rebranded Amazon Prime Video

Content: Watching CNN live shows on HBO Max, is utterly ridiculous. Not only is there no way to pause a live show, even momentarily, it also cannot stay in sync with the picture in a picture supported on iOS. Returning to the HBO app causes live shows on CNN to wildly scam across the timestamps. There is also no tracking in the player, meaning that you will not be able to go back to where you were watching. It seems like the live aspect of CNN is an entirely true. It seems like ads are piped in locally to your device, causing you to be out of sync with the CNN broadcast.an app that has been remade so many times it‚Äôs not even funny, you would think that this could be the simplest of things. But like every other attempt, HBO has tried with streaming apps, it is another failure.
Title: HBO is bumbling the CNN partnership

Content: I've been in HBO subscriber for about 20 years and it's only been about two years since I cut the cable and I've been streaming everything. I had a feeling when HBO changed it its name to the dubious "Max" (way to tank a premium brand) that we were headed in a not great direction, but they have exceeded my expected disappointment. Every month, I pay $15 a month so that they can make no customer service directly available to me. I don't expect that for $15 a month. Over the course of a year that's a respectable amount of money. If you're going to change to a streaming platform, if times are changing in that direction, you have to change with it and that means that you have to have your own customer service available. Every time I'm watching something and the screen times out or the app is flatlined and then I click on it to go back into it, it starts what I'm watching back from the beginning. There are not words to describe my frustration. Now I feel like I have no choice but to get HBO through a provider like Hulu or Sling, or Amazon Prime, all of which are in my life in some way. I could cable because I wanted to be rid of that. I like to have options, so that if I'm not getting good customer service, I can leave. I don't like feeling trapped. You have taken away my option to go directly to the provider. I'm paying for this.
Title: Programming great, app glitchy, customer service nonexistent.

Content: I‚Äôve used hbo max and max all together and have never experienced this much trouble casting. In order for an episode to play I‚Äôd have to stay on the application, if I were to check a text the episode would either load from the beginning or stop casting all together. It‚Äôs terribly inconvenient and really upsetting. Hoping the next update fixes these issues. I‚Äôve tried trouble shooting and it still happens consistently. I‚Äôm able to cast Amazon prime Hulu and Netflix just fine and I don‚Äôt have to keep signing in. When the transition from HBO max to max occurred I didn‚Äôt mind it since everything was going smoothly but it‚Äôs been prevalent that the performance is declining and the app is no longer user friendly. I Wish they‚Äôd go back to hbo max. I don‚Äôt tend to write bad reviews although it‚Äôs like they hired new grads to restructure the whole system. Nonetheless they could have spent more time the app rather than launching it when it clearly has more work to be done.

Content: I was very pleased with HBO MAX since its launch‚Äîgreat value, great content, good features good picture quality. However, MAX hasn‚Äôt live up to its promise. Too many bugs and the 4K Dolby Vision is mediocre‚Äîjust compare the Dolby Vision version of AVATAR on Disney+ and you‚Äôll see what I‚Äôm talking about. Ok, we got the addition of Discovery networks (though no one was asking for it), but after removing 4K Dolby Vision access from the ad-free $15.99 subscription, it is no longer a good value. HBO still offers good content, but  $19.99 for Max Ultimate and access to 4K is too expensive to keep for more than a month. We didn‚Äôt ask Warner/Discovery to bring their cable networks to HBO and charge a cable premium. I can‚Äôt imagine how much these streaming services are going to charge once their CEOs are forced to share their piece of the pie with the writers and actors who can‚Äôt even afford to pay for streaming services themselves.

Content: i have always appreciated how smooth HBO‚Äôs apps ran - no matter which platform HBOGO, HBO NOW, etc. i wish i could say the same about the new MAX. i couldn‚Äôt even use the service the first month as the my tv app would not recognize my password despite several resets - and was not offered any recompense! -and now that i finally can watch on my tv there is audio difficulty. 70% of the time i have to restart an episode to get sound to work. closed captions do not work at all! HBO apps used to have the most reliable captions, please fix these issues. pandering to a wider audience isn‚Äôt worth losing your existing customer base due to a lack of the quality we have come to expect.  8/27/23 UPDATE: downgrading to ONE STAR as most of the previous issues still occur, and some new ones have been added. when playback is paused then resumed it will start anywhere from 5 minutes back up to restarting the video completely. leaving an episode to finish later results in a black screen - it will not play at all. in your rush to scoop up some proverbial fat cash from consumers, you have neglected to provide a product that is worth paying for! Netflix charges almost half as much, and their service works pretty well most of the time. honestly service this is not worth the money even at the ‚Äúwith ads‚Äù level as it is pretty much impossible to watch anything on it without some sort of frustrating issue.

Content: This is an issue I did not face on the old HBO Max app, but face now on Max. In any shows, most recently White Lotus and Succession, transitions between scenes result in the video and audio stuttering. For example, in Succession this would happen when a shot changes from inside the office to birds eye footage of the city‚Äî big changes between scenes, not just two cameras switching. It only seems to happen on the iPhone application and is fine on my TV.   Furthermore, the 10 sec rewind button is mostly useless. It doesn‚Äôt work like Netflix, Prime, Youtube, or Hulu. Clicking it multiple times registers as a single 10 second skip back. On Max, I have to wait for the video to render, then click the button again in order to rewind 20 seconds, while on every single other service I can spam click and actually see the video render instantly, AND see a ‚Äú-10‚Äù, ‚Äú-20‚Äù, ‚Äú-30‚Äù, etc with every spam click to know exactly how far back i‚Äôm rewinding.   Fix this and I change my review because the content is actually good on this platform but the mobile app lacks in performance.
Title: Video playback stutters and 10 sec rewind button needs tuning.

Content: The amount of issues that come from trying to using any HBO streaming is migraine worthy. If you get it ‚Äúfor free‚Äù through other services, you‚Äôll be for a doozy if a time. For the past few months, my iPhone was randomly logged out while my iPad and Xbox series X MAX apps were fine but my phone kept refusing to log in, telling me I had to update my password. Finally after getting past that screen and logging in, I was met with a new message saying I wasn‚Äôt a subscriber. About 3 weeks ago, finally got past that issue. Well, it‚Äôs happening again but this time my phone works, my Xbox works but my iPad is giving me the same message runaround that my phone gave me for months. I try connecting to my subscriber and it won‚Äôt progress from the login screen. How and/or why is it so hard to have a simple login ID for subscribers who get it through other services (such as AT&T). Why does this only affect one device at a time? Why does it tell me that I‚Äôm not a subscriber when I use the login MAX made us create some months back? HBO Go was terrible, HBO Now was terrible, HBO Max was terrible and MAX is somehow the worst. HBO‚Äôs streaming apps is like the Bethesda Game Studios Creation Engine, same junk from years ago just updated to be made worse each time

I‚Äôm going back to paying for max/hbo on Amazon. We have zero issues using my son‚Äôs HBO membership on Amazon. Then you dropped off Amazon and we were forced to use yours. Super disappointing. Glad the channel is now available on other platform again. And it‚Äôs not an IP or Wi-Fi, download or device issue. We work from home and each of our offices are outfitted with their own connections with very fast business fiber optic, and everything else loads properly and doesn‚Äôt just quit working. One of us works as a backend engineer developer and a senior software engineer. and it‚Äôs easy as pie at keeping everything running beautifully and super fast. Not that you care, We‚Äôre sticking with Amazon and if you lock us out of third party streaming again, we‚Äôre done.

Title: The original was better

Content: HBO is known for producing some of the most entertaining and captivating media in the last 30 years. It is a full on shame that they have been sullied by this app.   If you want to watch your favorite HBO shows and movies, find a used DVD store and buy them there. You‚Äôll find that experience easier and more fulfilling than dealing with this piece of trash app. The UI is glitchy. The ‚Äúcontinue watching‚Äù feature is hit and miss. Their tech integrations with smart devices is still ‚Äúin progress‚Äù (good thing they only had a year to prepare for this).   Also note, if you pay for this service anywhere other than their website, the customer service agents will have no ability to assist you in any billing issues. Furthermore, they will refuse any refund requests out of hand as they claim none are offered for any reason.   If you think you want to pay for this, reconsider and, if you still want it - go seek help because obviously you shouldn‚Äôt be in charge of your own finances. This app is a waste of money and lacks any type of redeeming qualities.   AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Title: Bad app for a bad company

Content: I love HBO, Max or Max in so many different ways. First they have all of those movies that just came out of the movie theater that everyone wants to watch. They have way more options in every single category than I‚Äôve seen on a lot of streaming platforms. I will definitely be keeping my subscription!!! I also highly recommend this if you wanna have one or two streaming platforms that are affordable that have a ton of shows and movies on them! You will for sure get your moneys worth.

Content: I understand the need to stay relevant. However instead of improving it‚Äôs gotten worse. (If it ain‚Äôt broken don‚Äôt fix it).   Plenty to watch on this platform but I can‚Äôt stand the ‚Äúupdates‚Äù. Nothing gets saved in continue watching and it won‚Äôt show episodes I‚Äôve watched so I don‚Äôt know what episode I left off on! let alone the name of the new shows I start.   I‚Äôm a busy person and I love convenience. If I get the chance to sit down after a 24 hour shift at the ems station, I‚Äôd prefer if the UI didn‚Äôt piss me off.   This applies to the Roku app as well.
Title: Pointless

Content: Once again I was out offshore and unable to use the Max app formerly known as HboMax. This app constantly has issues offshore, the offline mode for downloads is terrible. This time it was a constant error saying we don‚Äôt offer HBO in your area when I have a paid subscription!! Why have customers pay to for downloads only to be unable to watch them when they need to (without internet). The most frustrating thing is, Amazon, Netflix, Disney, NONE of these other companies charge for downloads. Not only do they not charge they are always available when you don‚Äôt have service. There are to many options at this point to have to deal with these issues on a regular basis. I‚Äôve left feedback multiple times and nothing has changed. Time to leave HBO

Title: BLUE??

Content: I used to love HBO and now it‚Äôs about as aggravating as Hulu is for me.   First of all, when I watch hbo max on my home tv, it never saves my place in my tv series. I literally have so scroll through seasons and episodes to find where I left off. EVERY SINGLE TIME. That is unacceptable. No other streaming service does that.   Second of all, my recently watched is different from home tv to my cell phone‚Äôs recently watched EVEN THOUGH ITS THE SAME EXACT ACCOUNT?!?? I used to watch hbo allll the time off my phone, but I‚Äôve noticed recently that when I click on the app it doesn‚Äôt have a true ‚Äúmost recently watched‚Äù  So once again I‚Äôm having to look up what I‚Äôve recently watched.   And third of all the actually streaming of tv and movies glitches a lot.  From the sound going out to it being stuck on loading for minutes at a time  So my over all use of ‚ÄúMAX‚Äù is way too complicated and time consuming just to watch a 30 minute episode! I‚Äôm very disappointed.   And on side note WHY CHANGE THE COLOR?!?? I love the purple.

Title: To the Max

Content: Clunky clunk clunky. As in when I‚Äôm watching a movie/series as it cuts to the next scene it‚Äôll start that glitch looping thing it does like a record skipping,So then I have to fast forward a couple minutes to get past the problem, that‚Äôs a no go. Let‚Äôs see here‚Äôs another one -your option selection is ridiculous I‚Äôll explain. On the first of the month I went online to see what‚Äôs new on max this month and many‚Äôs sights show the exact content coming out (there‚Äôs plenty of content but none of it worth a crap) so when I go to the max app itself and look under just added there‚Äôs maybe 7 new movies or shows that pop up? Where‚Äôs the rest?  At least hbomax showed you all the new content on the app itself. Speaking of content and this is where it gets real bad. A documentary on Mary Tyler Moore‚Ä¶. Yea I‚Äôm serious. I‚Äôm 44 and that‚Äôs waaay for before my time. From what I‚Äôve been hearing max wants to attract a younger audience that was the point of this big merger from what I‚Äôve read. But ok.  Here‚Äôs another-Donna summer documentary‚Ä¶ omg are you serious? I‚Äôm mid 40s and i barely know who this is.But you keep attracting that younger audience I‚Äôm rolling my eyes. And the commercials have gotten longer and more frequent no doubt another no go. On the bright side I just have 2 more weeks and I‚Äôll be rid of this nonsense for good but I think I might just demand a refund.  Ps. I was on prime the other day and found a movie I liked but the only way to watch was to rent it or subscribe to Cinemax so I‚Äôm like cool I have max so it should be on there right?? Yea no not even close because that would make to much sense.  Pss. Checking out some free streaming apps I have and there‚Äôs equal to better content than max. Yea the free ones.  Psss. Mary Tyler Moore and Donna summers are great but I hope you understand my point.
Title: Complete trash

Content: The hbo max app had its own problems, but this app seems to have carried them over and adopted problems from other online streaming apps. I‚Äôm someone who regularly revisits certain episodes, and they make it inconvenient to revisit. I also am not fond of the linear way to view episodes rather than a grid. It also has the same exact error screen upon opening. (All I have to do is press the back button and it works) but you‚Äôd think that would be fixed with something different than just a similar error code. All in all, I was very comfortable with the original app and then they went and changed it in a way I‚Äôd imagine was an attempt to appeal to the masses without actually asking them. TLDR: I don‚Äôt mind the update, but I wish they had actually improved it instead of making it worse. I understand why the initial ratings were so low now.

Content: Hello, managers of the formerly HBO max now Max app. I recently convinced a certain someone to download Max as a means for long distance movie nights to keep the connection flowing despite our distance. I was sorely disappointed though... Unfortunately, the app had been rebranded to Max by the time I convinced this certain someone to download the app. I had faith, this was not the right move.  Perhaps I should have convinced her to download Hulu instead, Hulu still has their shareplay feature intact. I do not understand why the shareplay feature is no longer part of this organization and I would like answers as soon as possible. Better yet, I would like a solution. This adjustment could possibly wreak havoc on my relationship and i am not ready for that, Max. Please, get back to me. Sincerely, Violet W. A.

Content: Wish you guys didn‚Äôt acquire my favorite show would gladly buy a dvd player and buy dvds over this **** fix your software or get bent. Seriously do you have any ux people working there
Title: Meh rebranding a crap product

Content: With the HBO Max app, using my DirecTV HBO and Cinemax subscription, I had access to their 4K HDR content on my Ô£øTV 4K devices. Now today, with the new MAX app, my DirecTV (AT&T) subscription only gives me "Ad Free" service and no access to any of their content in 4K HDR... I would have to pay an additional $19.99 a month just for access to their 220 4K HDR titles! Also, the new MAX app has a terrible, sparse interface.  Please offer a way regain access to 4K to customers who already pay a lot of money for subscriptions thru providers like DirecTV (AT&T).
Title: Lost access to 4K HDR content

Content: I just upgraded to the new Max app, and I accidentally tapped my son‚Äôs profile and now I‚Äôm stuck in kids mode. I don‚Äôt know a parent code because I never set one up. I‚Äôm instructed to go to a web site to fix it, but when I log on with my cable provider, I keep getting error messages.  I love HBO content but this app rollout has not gone well for me!
Title: Locked out!

Content: Absolutely the dumbest thing ever. No reason to change or rebrand. Won‚Äôt recognize my subscription with YouTube and just completely unnecessary. Will be canceling my subscription moving forward.
Title: Garbage

Content: I tried to login into my Amazon tablet like I have for the past 18 months to watch my HBO app. I can‚Äôt get it to work‚Ä¶ Stop f$cling with stuff. Now I‚Äôm going to cancel my subscription, because I can‚Äôt watch it. It‚Äôs not like I can get anyone on a phone to help me, either.
Title: Why do you make things so difficult!

Content: So far this app has crashed 2 apple tv‚Äôs and my android tv too.
Title: Disaster.

Content: I have used the HBO Max app for multiple years and loved how much more organized and easy to use the interface was. The biggest disappointment was that the neatly organized hubs have been removed. No more organized Adult Swim collection, no more sorting for all the Studio Ghibli etc. now we have this weird Amazon blue themed mess with a home button and a search button. Why they went out of their way to remove functioning stable features is beyond me. They could have just removed HBO from the name and called it a day.   To add salt to the wound the app only plays audio with a black screen on my Apple TV. And no using the old app because that‚Äôs been shut down. So I guess I have to cancel my subscription until it‚Äôs actually a service again. Not really worth paying for just the audio of my favorite shows.
Title: Ruined a perfectly good app

Content: First, the user experience is messed up‚Ä¶ they add promotions and ads inside the content big mistake‚Ä¶ that equalize the platform to declining formats like Hulu. For me there is no problem including promotion on front, but interrupting the experience, big mistake.   Second, the content is incomplete and interrupted, for example The Nanny, they uploaded Season 1, Season 3, 4, 5, 6‚Ä¶   Let‚Äôs see if they fix this details‚Ä¶
Title: Really‚Ä¶

Content: I tried twice to sign in with YouTube TV account and it doesn‚Äôt work. It worked with the HBO Max app. This is terrible.
Title: If I could give no stars I would

Content: this app will not function when I log in through a provider. I simply get an error code despite trying every troubleshooting solution possible.
Title: doesn‚Äôt work when logging in with provider

Content: Double charged me day 1. Signed me out of every single device and had to spend almost 4 hours recovering e-mail, passwords, passwords for the TV of all things, and everything else under the sun.  Awful decision by an awful company. Even Hulu is better
Title: Awful app. Move to other services

Content: Do you want to go from fixer-upper to sopranos in a few simple clicks? Well, I don‚Äôt. This is just muddying the waters of the great content HBO Max had. Not to mention having to spend more to get 4k? Also, the UI keeps jumping to the top row when browsing. Also, let me mention again you now have to pay $19.99 instead of 14.99 a month for 4k because they had to add all 44 seasons of Diners, drive-ins, and Dives (no guy hate here, but this isn‚Äôt what I‚Äôm looking for when I want HBO content). Lame.
Title: Big eye roll

Content: Whomever created the MAX app must‚Äôve been the same that made the AMC+ app. It‚Äôs really bad - can‚Äôt read description text when you drill down the overlay is terrible, searching and browsing is about as clunky as it gets, generally unpleasant gui. Really miss the purple background - designers thinking ‚Äúhey, what‚Äôs the most generic sad blue background we have?‚Äù ü§Æ The ‚Äúbrand spotlight‚Äù is hidden in the search menu on iOS. Don‚Äôt get me started on how sluggish and the lag within the app using on the newest Apple TV 4K. ‚Ä¶what did you write this with? Can‚Äôt even see the ‚Äúup next‚Äù content in the main menu bar on the Apple TV? Piss poor execution and we actually appreciate the name ‚ÄúHBO‚Äù booooooooooo
Title: Dumpster fire

Content: You guys are more expensive than other companies. Make subtitles for many countries!! Netflix, Disney, Amazon, and Apple TV all have Korean subtitles!!
Title: Subtitles

Content: Off to a terrible start. Having to sign in multiple times via QR code, saying I‚Äôm good to go, asking me to sign in again. Repeat.
Title: So far so bad

Content: HBOMax app was never perfect, but at least it worked. 3 min into using the new one, it stops streaming. Throws up a 24 character error code (that you can‚Äôt copy) and freezes. Force quits and reinstalls don‚Äôt fix it.
Title: They broke it

Content: I gave it two stars because: Good transition from HBO Max to MAX. It was simple and easy but I‚Äôve switched to MAX literally no more than 5 minutes ago and  I get cut off with an error page popping up saying ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a problem with your device setup.‚Äù What does that mean? Then on the same page I‚Äôm given this incredibly long code to given if I contact them. Maybe once or twice I‚Äôve gotten those error pages on HBO Max and they were so far and in between I didn‚Äôt even remember them. Not gonna lie kinda miss HBO Max. Why‚Äôd you guys change things we‚Äôre fine, we‚Äôll for me anyway I‚Äôm sure you guys had your reasons but this isn‚Äôt doing for me. I just wanna watch ‚Äútbbt‚Äù lol
Title: 2 Stars

Content: Maybe HBO should just use the YouTube platform
